Very simple and fast bordercrossing. Took us only 20minutes, also our dog was no problem, even without papers from a veterinarian which are officially needed.
Only the road construction on the Russian side was a bit exhausting.

name: Parking area by main road
description: Nice spot for a night. Quiet. Amazing views down the valley.

name: On a meadow 400m away from highway
description: Follow the dirt road till it‚Äòs end towards an old  birch. You can still hear the noise of the car‚Äòs a little bit but they don‚Äôt really disturb. It‚Äòs a perfect place for an overnight stop, hidden and fairly quiet. Beeline Coverage 3G

name: Propane Gas Station
description: Refill of gas bottles easy possible here!

name: Little lovely lake
description: Close the main road there is this little lake with several litlle traditional wood house around. Little noisy from road and any train but very quiet. Three local teenagers visit us on evening, very kind people. Good stop and relax on the road.

name: River camp
description: Close a river and very near of Ba√Økal lake, you have this spot of relax and wild life. Hike to the mountain with very lovely vew on the lake and river (a lot of meanders). We have had the visit of a very kind sheper. Camp fire possible but no fire wood able in the area. Limit of Natural Parc, to be respectful. Enjoy it. Acces by 7km of dirt road.

name: Beach camps
description:
The paradise, this is the first of 3 wild beachs where you can camp, there are diferent acces and connexions ways between this 3 beachs. From here maybe better 4wd to go directly to the others beachs, with 2wd make a more big turn around the hills. Or by feet...there are very lovely hikes.

This first and the 3th beach are in old rivers valleys (no rivers now). The beachs are the end of two flat and large green valleys. A lot of spots and camp fires to choose, wood fire in the area.

Big rigs: the acces from north (52.772513, 106.556908) have 5m bad meters for you, it's depens of your distance between axes...

Perfect to camp any days, nobody in the zone in june. Maybe there are people in summer...

name: Easy laundry
description:
It's really not self-service...they help you to understand how all it works. You can go and come back to take your clothes clean and drys.
1 Wash machine: 120 rublis
1 dry machine: 100 rublis
1 soap dosis: 20 rublis.

Cordenates aprox. It's behind the big building and underground, acces by stairs down. See picture for details.

name: River camp
description: Close a nice large river, in a quiet and nice area. Acces by good dirt road. Place for everybody. Good for one night or more. Local fishing place. Little wood fire is able.

name: Spot near beautiful river
description: Camping spot at the river with small cabin for cooking and sitting. Clean beach and sandy river ground. The place can be accessed by a sand trail, 4x4 recommended (see picture of road). Some rubbish lying around but quite clean compared to other spots in Russia. A few people passed by but not too many.

name: pic cherskogo hotel
description: 1500 rublos for persone. parguing. restautant first line al.algo baikal spectacular views is next to the train

name: Forest path parallel to highway
description: Good place to stay for an overnight stop. On a flat, grassy area at the side of a forest path. It‚Äòs only 50-100 m from the highway so of course you hear the cars passing by. Beeline coverage .

name: Border Maskatov Kazakhstan - Russia
description:
Nothing to pay to exit KZ and to enter RU.
2 hours in total to cross the border  (1 hour queue before entering the Kazakh 's side, 1 hour for all the out and in process ).
Insurance offices on both sides in small converted container shops.

name: OSAGO insurance
description: Finally found a very helpful chap (very little English) to offer us the OSAGO insurance we needed for our British car. No one else we tried at border or banks etc would help us. Requires passport, ownership document and temp import paperwork from the border

name: Bakery... lovely!
description: A gorgeous bakery, very busy with locals. No English description but everything seems nice... particularly the savoury pastries. Very popular with locals. If you are staying at Elizar, eat breakfast here

name: Beach camp
description: Nice wild campsite on the beach. It is 1,5km from the road, so very quite.

name: Three Brothers
description: Famous landmark of Olkhon, only accessible by 4x4 or local tour.

name: Campsite near Cape Khoboy
description: About 1km from the northest point of Olkhol there is a small campsite. You‚Äôll find a pit toilet, some benches and wooden shelters/picknick areas. Only accessable by 4x4, since the roads to the north are terrible.

name: Official national park campground
description: Official campground of the national park. Located in the forest with great views over Baikal. You‚Äôll need a permit to stay the night. Pit toilet, shelter and benches are found at the campground. Fire making is allowed. You‚Äôll probably need a 4x4 to drive through the muddy forest trail.

name: Nyurganskaya bay beach
description: Nice sand beach that runs from Peschanaua village. You can drive on the beach. Nice place to see the sunset. Water had - like many beaches in Olkhon - algae.

name: –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏–π Supermarket
description: Biggest supermarket on Olhon. Fishing gear and oil is also for sale here.

name: Rinpoche Bagsha parkingcamp
description: Next to the temple is a parkingarea. We found over 10 Chinese overlander campers there, so spending the night is no problem at all. Great views over Ulan Ude.

name: Turka seaside camp
description: Opposite the lighthouse there is a parkingplace where we found lots of campers. Nice views over the lake!

name: Monhakhovo beach camp
description: Nice Russian camp near a bay st Monahkhovo village. Lots of fishermen and families spend the night here. Every campspot has a small wooden shelter with benches. And there‚Äôs a small shop.

name: Alla hot spring campground
description: At the entrance (/staircase) to Alla hot spring. You can rent a room or camp on the site. Price for camping is 70 rbl. Lots of mosquitoes. Pit toilets, potable water available. Road is pretty good, it‚Äôs offroad but the track is clearly visible, we followed the path indicated on maps.me and it was accurate. Awesome views on the mountains, nice hot spring.

name: Alla hot spring
description: Nice hot spring. Free to use. Open 24/7. There‚Äôs a little banja-like house where you cam enter, the mud is said to be ‚Äòmagical‚Äô. There is some accommodation at the entrance. You can find it on maps.me. The main road from Barguzuin to Alla is pretty good and very scenic. The road to the spring is a track through the woods, about 6-7 km from the main road, there is a sign.

name: Camping at Selinger Lake
description:
lovely spot at a beach side at Selinger Lake.
During Russian summer holidays there were many locals camping but it didnt feel crowded. good spot for fishing and you can find wild strawberries in the forest.
there is a small supermarket 5 minutes away.

name: Wild spot
description: Just beside the road there is a beautiful spot right beside a little river who is going to join the lake at a wooden bridge  No traffic at all during the night.

name: Truck stop
description: Truck (TIR) stop. lots of parking. two places to eat with good WiFi. pay to use Toilet. Can get insurance here. Woman in fuel station refused us but the lady in the cabin by the hotel was very very helpfulll.

name: Parking Spot on road to nowhere
description: An amazing spot to camp, very very quiet and amazing scenery. The road is brand new and very smooth and goes to a military base. There are a few spots adding the way that make great wildcamping places.

name: Urban Oasis
description: A parking lot next to the River, located at a beach bar. A lot of small bars and caf√©s here. We asked the guard if we can stay over night, because usually the parkinglot closes at 9pm. It was no problem. You can hear the cars which cross the bridge, but for inner city parking it is very quiet and the best...no mosquitos.

name: Truvor Hotel
description:
Amazing little hotel if you need a very affordable stopover option, we stayed here because of bad weather and it can not be beaten on value. Superb! 
I think we paid about ¬£38-¬£40 for the night and it included breakfast

name: Spring Water
description: Locals refill their drinking bottles - natural source.

name: Supermarket
description: Good supermarket and different small shops

name: Tire shop
description: Great tire shop, cheap russian quality and changing (incl balance and put on rim) for 20‚Ç¨. Nice people but nobody speaking english...

name: Land Rover Garage Krasnojarsk
description:
Shiny dealership that sells Land Rovers. They have a garage in the rear and helped me out sourcing parts for my Defender. 

Tel: +7 391 205 22 22
Tatuana speaks some English!

name: Camping Eko
description: A nice simple campsite with hot showers and clean toilets. Close to river with nice pitches. WiFi also works but not that fast.

name: bushcamp on a triangle surrounded of birches
description: Arround 500m from the end of a small village there is a flat place on a meadow where three dirt tracks are crossing. No 4x4 needed, but it could be difficult when it‚Äòs raining. Quiet place, only some fishermen passing by and a shepherd may ask you for a Wodka. No Mobil data coverage.

name: Lake Krasnodar
description: Small grassy area next to a small street and the lake. Good swimming opportunities. Unfortunately some mosquitos and some noise of the bigger road.

name: Hotel Red Rose
description: Nice and cheap little Hotel. Incl. breakfast, shared kitchen facilities, secure parking, good WIFI. single room for rubel 1'500.00, can be booked over booking.com, no credit cards accepted, no english but works with google translate,  just a little bit of the road, last few meter small gravel road

name: Kulaevo
description: Irbis restarea. Noisy because of the road, but all the services are at the top. Good stop before going in Kazan.

name: 4x4 repair shop (Land Rover)
description: Andrej is specialized in Defenders and other offroad cars and is well connected in the offroad community in Russia, so if you have a problem he will be able to help you definately better than most of the official LR garages in and around Rostov.  Of course some spare parts for Defenders can take a while to organize in Russia.

name: motoclub dogged
description:
motoclub you can stay and support the motorcyclist community of the city.
no showers with kitchen and closed parking

name: Kazan-Lokomotiv Beach
description: Beautifull places at the end of the road, at the Volga River. Many others at the beach. Any people playing music, but not too loud.

name: BEK Car-Insurance
description:
There we had no problems to make our Insurance for complet Russia. 
Car: Steyr-Puch Pinzgauer from Switzerland 
with 3.50to weight

5 Month cost 7092.00 RUB

name: Little house
description:
Very basic place, but the owner is a great great person. He doesn't speak English so we talked by Google translate. He's trying to set up the place, actually it has not shower but an authentic Russian sauna, wich is the true way they shower.
There is electricity, running water from a pump outside and a letrine. Really basic but nice to feel the traditional way of life. 
I stayed for free, but maybe you'll have to talk with Igor. If you are coming by bicycle like me, for sure you will be very welcome. There is also space for some tents. Phone: +7 961 106-48-51

name: Border Russia to norway
description:
Fast border for immigration. Costumes, took one h to check literally all my bags in a land rover defender. Been on the road for 5years. Loads of things to discuss. But in the end didn‚Äôt find anything he was not happy with. 
Open till 2100

name: Wildcamping next to stream
description: Beautiful place, just follow the track off the road. There are thousands of places to camp.

name: guesthouse prozhivaniye
description: rooms with shared bathroom in family house. breakfast included.600 rubles per person.wifi.

name: Black African
description:
good and kind motocycle machanic
if you want, you can stay

website: https://m.facebook.com/groups/913801898751111

name: amazing spot next to the river Volga
description: Amazing spot next to the river Volga. it is possible to park on the water but we can't be sure if the level rises.

name: Wild camping
description:
A user reported on 13-09-2018: If you are trying to go there via NALIVNOE, max. height 3,20m. 
---
Wild camp spot away from everyone else. Beautiful lake.

name: U-Hostel
description: Great Hostel (2 rooms; 9 bed for men and 6 for women). Save parking space in the backyard with rooftop (for cars and motorcycles). Close to the Kreml and supermarkets are around the corner. The hostel has AC  and looks quite new and is very clean. Costs 400 Rubel/night

name: –†–æ—Å–≥–æ—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö –ü–µ–Ω—Å–∏—è Car Insurance
description:
We found this insurance which was willing to insure our car in Russia. Our German insurance only covers the part of Russia up to Ural. 

At the address 7a is the headquarter of the insurance " –†–æ—Å–≥–æ—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö –ü–µ–Ω—Å–∏—è". They are located on the first floor of a somewhat posh looking building. 

We paid about 10k Rubels for 4 months insurance for our old Landcruiser (no Casko though). It was a bit difficult to communicate but some people there spoke some fairly decent English.

name: Spar Shopping
description: Spar Shopping with big Parking Space for Free

name: forest
description: in the forest you can find some nice campnping spots. Hidden from the road .

name: Hotel / Camping Baltica
description:
Hotel Baltica ( *** ) with a Campground in the Garden. Showers and Toilet in the Hotel.

Electricity and Free WiFi available

Price (2.pers/car/ no Power ) RUB 1'250.00
Showers ( RUB 100.00 )and Electricity cost extra

Bus to City Center direct at the Front of the Hotel. Bus Number 75 and 37

name: Green stop - motel, food, shower
description: Next to busy road but has showers, toilets, WiFi, cafe and is 24hr. Looks newly constructed and is being added to. Also a basic looking motel on site. Has a mechanic and tyre stop as well but not fuel

name: Guarded parking next to Teplo hotel
description:
Convenient secure parking near port, train station, restaurants,..
There is a guy onsite 24h, even sleeps in the small cabin.
Price for the night was kind of confusing, he charged few hundred Rubles and in the end we left the car almost 2 days there..

name: Stoyanka, but next to small forest
description: Stoyanka with a restaurant. The good point about this spot was the quiet little forest just next to it.

name: Noisy stoyanka next to railway (avoid)
description:
It was pitch dark, raining and we were so tired that we decided to stop here.
The spot is close to a noisy railway where trains run 24h, so better avoid it to spend the night.
There is a local restaurant.

name: Great spot by small lakes!
description:
Cool spot between few small lakes. 
It is located between the road and the railway, but is very quiet at night.

name: Quiet spot by river and lake
description: Good spot not far from the road, but still quiet.

name: Cafe 777 (showers, laundry, guesthouse,...)
description:
The famous Cafe 777. There are clean showers, toilets, restaurant, shop and a guesthouse.
Showers 100 Rubles/PP. 100 Rubles for laundry.

name: Stoyanka with Banya, hostel, tire repair
description:
Not a very sexy choice, but there was nothing much on the road before that.
There is a guesthouse with banya and a small tire repair shop.
Petrol station just next to it.

name: Gostiniy Dom (hostel + secure parking)
description:
THE overlander place in Chita!
The rooms are very clean and comfy.
We parked and slept in their secure parking (300 Rubles a night)
They have a shared kitchen and sell some food and drinks.
Showers and laundry available on demand.
The entrance for vehicles is behind the block here: 52.033636, 113.434886

name: Cute traditional restaurant and great food
description: Authentic Siberian restaurant serving tasty home cooking.

name: Free spot right by the lake Arey
description: This spot is just next to several camp grounds. We parked and camped right by the lake and surprisingly it was quiet and not too crowded.

name: Propane station
description: Propane station apparently open 24 hours.

name: Wild camping by lake Baikal
description: There are lots of spots to stop along this peninsula. This is the last spot before a newly-built resort.

name: Viktoria Hotel (secure parking)
description: Not exactly a traveller's hotel, but they have a large secure parking right in front of the hotel. Clean rooms, fast Wi-Fi, good coffee. Centrally located.

name: Wild camp next to lake
description: Around 50km away from border, not too far from a little lake small even surface to camp for one night

name: Laundry in Novosibirsk
description:
Laundrette wehre you can wash your clothes. The business is hidden in some sort of small shopping mall in the very back of the building. Please see the pictures to know, which signs you need to look out for. 

We paid 450 rubles for washing and drying two machines. The lady there does not speak English at all but with patience and an app you'll manage.

Hours: 10-20

name: filling gas bottle
description: here you can fill you're gas bottle. we paid 180 roebels for 7 l.

name: poroshino
description:
de.ocio complex with hotel sauna restaurant and private parking.
good facilities 500 rubles individual with shared bathroom and 1600 double with bathroom.
excellent deal for the.staff

name: station 33
description:
hostel museum of motorbike barbiker mechanic workshop and laundry vehicles.
excellent staff
from 500 rubles in a shared room to 2000 the private one with bathroom

name: Kamenka beach, Murino
description: Amazing spot right by the lake, surrounded by a small forest

name: Camping on the river
description: Very nice camping with table under shade, toilet and river crossing.

name: Large car repair
description: We went here for a quick fix.  The guys were friendly and helpful and spoke some basic English. Very large place for any kind of car repairs.

name: Marina
description:
Nice Place by Marina with Shop, Shower and Toilet. 
Not public so might not always get you a shower :-)

name: BaikalRai, Andrej Gorbunow
description:
nice Place for big Cars nearby Baikal see...surrounded compound 
top...

name: Mercedes Truck
description: New Truck repair services for Mercedes Benz, friendly People

name: @Seaside
description:
Place under Trees directly at the Border of the Sea with a Beach. Some Russian Peoples are also there. 

Slippery and Muddy Way when is wet. Only 4x4

name: truckersparking
description:
very friendly owner. He's from Georgia and it was no problem to camp here with rooftoptents.
He also have  clean rooms and a restaurant.
Don't miss from spot. It's nog the dirty truckers parking before all the shops if you come from direction Samara. It's the place just after the shops.
There's also a little grassfield where you can put a tent.

name: Campsite at Jenissej
description:
Nice campsite at Jenissej on the other side of Kyzyl and the monument  of the Asian centre. Many locals but most of them don‚Äôt stay over night 
You can make fire. Some mosquitoes at dawn.
Good coverage MTS and Beeline

name: museum motorbike
description: Incredible museum of a former champion of motorcycles 200 rubles

name: in the forest
description: nice place in the forest near the village Katavka. just take the pavement road through the village till the end. then you see some roads that goes info the forest. locals are very friendly.

name: Masenkovskiyi
description: Place next to some fields and an overgrown lake. Some mosquitos at night. We saw a farmer in the morning who did not care.

name: Toll Station / National Park
description:
Toll Station to entry the Nationalpark "Kurisches Haff"
Price Car : RUB 150.00
Price pP : RUB 150.00

Credit Cards accepted.

name: Towards EU Border
description: Last cheap Russia Fuel before the Border. Attention the Fuel Price in LT is near the double from the Russin Price

name: On the river side
description: We spent one wonderful and peacefull night there. Few other locals are going in this place to fish, and eventually sleep there too. The river is very calm. No services

name: Cafe Restaurant
description: Excelent food. Not cheap but not too expensive either. Very good quality and friendly people, English menu (on request) and fast internet.

name: BaykalSki
description: Nice hotel, great after 1 day of non-stop raining. Price was 1000 rubla for person in a 3 bed room. It also has a sauna. The hotel theme is very sporty. Internet was slow. Parking available for big rigs.

name: Grandpa's garage
description:
Excellent garage with very kind people whose speak a little bit english (pretty rare to be noticed). Cheap price.
This one should be an example for all other garage.

name: Propane refill
description: Possibility to refill your propane bottle in this station for 376 rubles

name: rooms
description: you can rent a room here, it's something between a hotel/b&b and camping. No running water but a very good sauna/banja to wash yourself.  Very friendly people, place to park your car/ big rig, shops at 5 km

name: secure parking
description: Truckstop with secure parking, restaurant, small shop and petrol station, good for one night. Showers 150 R, toilet 15 R, parking 100 R for one night. Tell the guard you will sleep here, he will put you on a quiet place.

name: Camp Spot on the other side off the woods
description: When you are driving from uralsk to saratov. Its About 150km after the border. There are a lot if Nice spot next to a dirt road not far from the High way.

name: Insurance for Russia
description: Nice lady. Does not speak English but obtaining the insurance for Russia took only 20 minutes. Cost 2380 Rubles for a Toyota Landcruiser HJ60 for 15 days.

name: Motel-Cafe car park
description: Just off the E105, this motel and cafe is popular with truck drivers and has room behind the building if you're not too big (we're 7 metres long and had no problems). Parking is free and the restaurant is open from 7-22. We didn't try the restaurant but it was popular!  No wifi but you can discretely use the toilet in the restaurant. Given the options this place is pretty good.

name: near small monument
description: You turn up at the truckers parking and then you find a small road after the building and just drive this road till the end. Then you arrive at a small monument with flat ground and some gravel. You can still hear the road  but otherwise is a very nice place to camp. we camped here with 2 roof top tents.

name: LADA Camping
description:
Very nice place for one week...
Clear water in the River Wolga....parking in the wood ...restaurant, energy, drinking water, toilets, shower, wifi for 600 rubel per night....friendly staff ... Chef is Andrey

name: Tatiana Spring
description: Clean and cold spring, mineral taste, no hose

name: Next to river
description: Nice place just 500m beside highway, next to the river. Some mosquitos

name: Hostel Uyut
description:
Small but very cozy place, also rather budget-friendly in Saratov. 
Important is you have to enter from the Backyard, but it IS very secure. Motorcycles can Park there, dont know about Cars.
Owner speaks english.

name: next to the river
description:
Beautiful campingspot near the river. First you've to drive through the village and then you find a little gravelroad aprox 2 km further. When you take the gravel road a little bit further you've a Y junction and turn left. There you see some strucures of building. pass that and drive further to the river.
A lot of space to camp.

name: Motorcycle Parts
description: Filter, Oil (also Motul), and other stuff.

name: Wild camping
description: About 2km in to the forest, little side road. Pretty flat. Not suitable for big rigs. Tent might be possible. I guess I heard a car passing by last night. Very quiet and u hear the river some meters away.

name: View on the little lake
description:
Perfect place to spend a night. View of the lake, and without mosquitos !
Some locals come in the morning to fish. Quiet place even if it's close to the main road. 
This is a noisy place. There is nothing between the 400 m to the road and this place which keeps the traffic noise away. Also the terrain is muddy.

name: Ferry
description: Ferry to cross the river (road to Ust Bargusin). See image for times.

name: pechki lavochki
description: great resturant with local food, big varaiety. vegiterian too. prices are not bad (but not very cheap, too...) and the taste is very good! clean western toilet. wifi if you have a local phone number.

name: kirsvosk
description: The place is near a river bottom of mountain. Necessary 4wd.

name: Kchibiny Mount
description: place in the mountains access only I'm summer.  Necessary 4wd.

name: Mount Lovozero
description: Place up on the Montain 1032 m. Beautiful  view 360 4wd necessary

name: Island Sredniy
description: place in the Montain and lakes wild environment. 4wd necessary

name: 'art' park near swimming lake
description: th√© park is busy sturing the dat, quiet at night. You can swim in the lake. Picknick tables with view on beautiful sunset.

name: By the river
description: Green spot beside a small river. Well off from the main road. Just outside of a small village. You can be seen from the road leading to the village but not much traffic going there.

name: At the lake
description: Official rest spot near the main road. You can drive between the trees right next to the lake. There is a small wooden pier and also a small swing in the lake. Good spot for overnight or just a quick swim brake from the driving

name: Large truck stop
description: This large truck stop with toilets and showers is one of a few to choose from at the intersection of the E22 and E95 near Pustoshka. We chose it because we were slightly off the main road and had only a few trucks. We didn't pay anything and the locals were tolerant.

name: Parking next to the river
description: Free Parking lot next to the river. Had no problems staying here overnight, but it is really noisy also at night because it is aside of a busy road. Difficult to find a toilet around there.

name: Tarasovskiy
description: Place next to a river/lake. Quiet and a lot of nature around. Gets quite muddy if it is raining.

name: Kropotovo
description: Grassy area next to a monument between some forest and fields. Really quiet and few mosquitos.

name: Stary Tscherek
description: Quiet place next to some lakes. A bit of trash lying around. Nice to go swimming.

name: Self service laundry and hyper market
description: Enormous hyper market with every thing you could possibly need: ATM, SIM cards, laundromat, supermarket, sports and outdoor shops, car accessories and engine oil so on and so on

name: nightingale & fishermen
description: newr to the highway at a small river, hided by trees. fishing spot. loud from the highway, but nightingale is louder

name: Angler-Wiese
description: free grass field at Wolga side arm. need 4x4 if wet

name: picknick place at lake
description: picknickplace in the forest at a lake. fireplace, roof topped table.

name: perfect place
description:
not to see from the road,  wind protected, nice view, wood for bonfire, 
...

name: tea stop. chai station.
description: fresh russian chai from samowar with selfmade forest sirup and herbs inside.

name: Valley View
description: not at the big river with all se moscitos and russian campers. Next to a small rivulet and next to the forest, a little up at the foot of the mountains with a nice viee over the valley. you can see the street but you are far away and nobody matters. firewood!

name: RIVER
description: Mountain View at river. Wide grass area surroundet with trees not to see from the street. at afternoon children swimming, during night some fishermen. all nice, nobody drunken.

name: bushcamping
description: stay in the grassy area near a dirt road, some lokals drive along the way.... quite, only sounds of the nature

name: place behind Dinamo Stadion
description: the place is behind the stadion, it is grassy and quite. some peoples come with the dogs to traine them and some planes goes over there, but not too many and not in the night

name: Hostel Blagodat
description:
Cheap and clean. Good facilities. They let us park our car securely behind the fence on the hostel grounds. 

300 rubels for a dormitory bed. 850 rubels for a private twin room. Free laundry. 

Taxi to city center is between 85 and 150 rubles (depends on time of the day)

name: Boats to Solovetskie island
description: A place where boats depart. Better have a booking. Its busy in summer time. Bookings can be made trough prichalrk.ru Its in English also. Price is 1600 rubl one way per person. Bring your passport. Its possible to pay with bank card. English tour in monastery is 650 rubl per person and can be bought only once you‚Äôre on the island.  24 hour parking on the dock is 200rubl. We spent a night here and its great authentic place!

name: Between the lakes
description: 10 or so different sites to choose from. Right at the lake. There is camping sign on the main road. Follow that road past the cabins and you will end up here.

name: Clear cool water
description: Follow the path going down for some meters. There is a wooden shed where the well is. Locals come here to fill up bottles.

name: Taganay National Park
description: Entrance of the national park. Plenty of hikes here, good information center.

name: Taganay National Park - official campsite
description:
The park itself is not accesible by cars. So there are 2 option; sleep inside the park with a tent. Or stay in the campsite near the information center, both are run by the park administration. 

The campsite is basic, but nice, 150 R per car per night.  There are some houses (dom's) you can rent, there is a banja and a grass field where you can pitch your tent. Other option is to park at the parking area between the houses and grassfield and sleep in the car. We drove our Defender onto the field and slept in the rooftoptent.

name: Lake Tulpyavr
description: Not that far from Murmansk. Has MegaFon reception, a lake, firepit, grill, table and some logs. Also some sizzling power lines. If you don‚Äôt mind the electricity lines then this is pretty nice place. On the small hill overlooking the lake.

name: Valdaysky NP Camping and Picnic Area
description: Nice camping and picnic spot at a lake. Locals come here as well and it can get a bit noisy during the evening but in the night it is very quiet. We paid a small entrance fee at the national park information center in Valday but we were not controlled anywhere. Thus, it is probably not necessary to pay the fee.

name: Valdaysky NP Camping at a Lake
description: Very beautifully set and quiet camping spot directly at a lake. The lake is clean and it is possible to swim in it.

name: River Selenga ferry to/ from Ilyinka
description:
Ferry over the river Selenga. It is a ferry for vehicles over 3 t especially trucks carrying wood. You‚Äôre feet‚Äôs maybe won‚Äôt stay dry but all in all the ferry does it‚Äôs job.
For vehicles under 3t there is another ferry about 5 km up the river. 

The road after the ferry until the village Ostrog is not good but it‚Äôs worth it taking the ferry instead of driving over Ulan Ude to the north of the Baikal Sea.

They take extra charge for tourists I guess. We paid 1000 Rubels. The truck drivers about 380 rubels.

name: Good market in Tuwa
description:
These are the coordinates for a good market in Kyzyl. You can buy vegetables, fruits and berry‚Äôs outside and meat, milk, butter, etc. inside.

If you drive west from Kyzyl take care having enough fresh things with you. You can find them in the magazines but they don‚Äôt have much and not in a good quality.

name: Laundry in Kyzyl
description:
Nice and functional laundry in Kyzyl.
It is selfservice but they are very nice and will help you. If you have lot stuff to wash, choose a sunny day because the drying machine doesn‚Äôt dry completely.

name: Rolling Stones Hostel
description: This place is buzzing, it is really popular and very well set up. The parking is off the street but small and cramped during the week days. After 6pm and before 8am you can park in front of the hostel door and camera. Car park is empty over the weekend. Incredibly they have allowed us to park and shower for free!! We have paid 160 for washing machine and dryer though and we have bought their beers and drinks to contribute in a different way. Really great spot!

name: sheltered with vieW
description: Just off the road but very quiet and out of view. Nice view of the fields. Sheltered from wind. Good for one night.

name: truck stoo
description: Truck stop with motel, showers, toilet, mechanics and gas station, good for one night, 150R

name: Region 24 for camping car with shower
description: Here is a complex with petrol station, hotel and truck, car, van parking with toilette, shower and laundry facility. Cost for our Defender was 50 roubles for the night, 200 roubles for shower and 20 roubles for toilet. Very useful on the way from Irkutsk to Novossibirsk or back !

name: Nice place at the Angara river
description: Quite, clean place with nice view of the Angara river. Close to the city and only 15 min driving to the airport.

name: Quiet gravel pits
description: I was here in early August and there wasn't a single mosquito!  Can still hear some highway traffic but I had the whole place to myself.  Follow the dirt track off the road by an abandoned bus stop and you'll come to a small gravel pit.  follow the track further for another one.

name: Cute Stoyanka with helpful staff
description: Cute stoyanka 300m from the road. The lady at the front desk was extremly helpful and spoke a little English. They let us stay in their kitchengarden behind the house. We felt totally welcome and taken good care of. They have a cafe with tasty meals and wonderful hot showers for 150 r pp. Staying the night in the car costs 150r.

name: Beautiful spot by river
description: Follow the 4x4 tracks from the main highway. I used the tracks south of the spot but I believe there are also tracks here from the north.  maps.me has the tracks.  there was 1 other car here but it left.  seems like a frequented wild camping spot.

name: Change o√Øl motul / Shell ...
description: Good place to change your oil, friendly guys, little English, 400roubles + oil

name: Hotel Palma
description:
Small modern clean hotel with friendly staff about 2 miles from the LR Dealer where we left our landy whilst waiting for spare parts. 
2800 roubles a night with massive breakfast included. We used booking.com to get a better deal.

name: Lake Baikal
description: Cross the river back to town, approach from the west. There is a track along the river.

name: Hostel NICE
description: The hostel has a safe parking place behind the building. Ask the staff before parking there if it's possible. They have been very friendly and helpful and charged us 500 rubles per night, shower and bathroom usage.

name: Nice spot right next to a big river
description: Bushcamping right on an elevated river bank. Follow the dirt track that turns off the highway. It‚Äòs a fair bit from the road, so you are well hidden and there‚Äòs only a little noise from traffic and the railway. Bring lots of mosquito repellent!

name: Supermarket
description: Good large supermarket with lots of bread and vegetables.

name: Behind a hill
description: A bit of a bump to get over to get on the track.  Beautiful spot in the hills with a view of snow capped peaks.

name: Burinskaya datcha
description: Quiet place next to the river, where you can bath. Easy access for all. We are alone, plenty of wood available, only a few kilometers from the main road.

name: wild camp near a river
description:
You can park here near a little river.
Not so far from the road but hidden from it.

name: Guesthouse Na svetloy
description:
Very nice place to stay! They just finished the builing so everything is brand new. Not so much the location (it's in a decent neighbourhood, but not so much to do arround). But the room is clean, spacious and decorated in a european style. The owner was super kind and offerd us to join there diner. 
1 double room: 20$ 

There is a big garden with fence to park your car. I think the owner is ok with sleeping in your own car (don't know how much that would be).

name: Iverskogo Monastery
description: Parking place just before the island where the monastery is, great views of the monastery and the lakes.

name: Auto Kor
description:
We came here to get ready for Mongolia. The owner speaks fluently English and two guys of the garage next door speak German.
They did a really great job and we discovered great Russian hospitality, when we stayed the night at the workshop.
Highly recommended.

name: Lake View Paradise
description: Off the main road a small, but not lose dirt track leads to a river/lake with nice accessible mini beaches. If you like you can cross the river at a stony, but deep (40 - 50 cm) crossing. Fireplaces around, many fish in the lake, a lot of birds to watch, medium amount of mosquitoes. A little paradise! No reception.

name: Rapids on the river
description: Rapids on the river. Called "Devotschin Pljus". More places to camp along the way to here.

name: Chuya Deer Stone & Petroglyphs
description: Very faint en damaged deer stone and some drawings in the nearby rockface. Fun 5 minute stop along the highway.

name: Old road to Chike Taman pass
description: Way more fun then the new asphalt road. Easily accessible by a 4x4.

name: Public well in Kochieniovo
description: Fresh water, just help yourself, it's free! Coordinate might not be very accurate since we added the point after we left, just look on the right side of the road and you'll find it, a couple of hundred meters away in the worse case.

name: Kachkanar
description: Closed/forbiden city. No checkpoint at the entrance, we were told it is written somewhere along the way (in Russian only). Been questionned by the police during hours with pictures and all the kit. Received a fine of 2000 rub each. French readers can read our detailed "experience" on our blog, article's title is Cauchemar √† Kachknar. In any case, don't go, even if the lake and mountain there look attractive. Same treat in her neighbour Lesnoi. Check out wikipedia to know more on the subject and obtain a partial list of all concerned towns.

name: Golden Camel / Tydtujaryk Campimg
description: Very nice official campground with super nice people. They speak okay English and one guide spoke even German. We could sleep in our van for 150 Rubel per person per night. The food is quite good and the banja was amazing. They also organise tours every day. More info in camp-altai.ru (also english version). Just follow the main road until km 871 (direction to Mongolia). There you will see kind of a huge billboard. Turn left and continue on the gravel road for 1 mile.

name: in front of the botanical garden
description: it's busy in evening but quiet at night

name: Camping on the river
description: Established campground, big sign on the road, you can let yourself in. Paid 200 rbl for 2 people. Lots of trees, picknicktables etc. Further along the road towards Chemal there aren‚Äôt a lot of options. Good MTS signal.

name: Insurance for Kazachstan & Russia
description: Just before the border, several shops sell insurance for Kazachstan. We paid around 40 US dollar for 1 month for our Land Rover. They don‚Äôt accept cards and you can pay in Dollars or Roebels

name: Hotel on Lva Tolstogo
description:
Simple hotel with funky bedding. 
Shared bathroom and showers. 
No kitchen, but microwave and kettle available in reception. Snacks and drinks are sold behind reception. 
Free onsite parking. 
1500r for three people for one night. 
Free WiFi available. 
No English spoken.

name: Mobil Center
description: Very well equipped and educated mechanics. Know their profession. Willing to help. Only small boxes, no big rigs. Helped us outside on the street.

name: Katu-Yaryk hairpins
description: Hairpins on the road to the south tip of Teletskoye lake descending to the river. Nice viewpoints around. Bottom part is quite steep, motorcycles and 4WD could make it, but I've seen 2WDs towed up by tractor :).

name: Ferry from south to north and vice versa
description: There is a ferry carrying cars and motorbikes between north and south tips of the lake. Prices what I have been told are 10000 rubles for a car and 4000 for a motorcycle. Transport should be arranged in advance. Telephone number: 8 962 582-60-32. There is no Beeline coverage on the road south of Teletskoye.

name: Fresh water near the border of Asia and Europe
description:
1/2 ‚Äú tube fits, good pressure, clean
Close to the border of Asia and Europe

name: Border KAS - RUS
description: Small border post. No hustle. Car insurance booths on KAS and RUS side before the barrier for both countries. Car inspection on RUS entry side very detailed.

name: Local ‚ÄúGeyser‚Äù
description: Hidden spring amongst woodland, accessed by a walkway through marshland. Car parking and a few cabins by the road, follow the grass tracks first, then the walkway, then mud path.

name: Site at the river in Kungur
description: Nice place close to the city of Kungur and at the river. Drive to the end and it gets very big.

name: Lawn at the river
description: Follow a piste to a small cemetery (can be found in maps.me) and then turn left. Plenty of space for camping directly at the river. Good for fishing too! MTS had a bad 3G signal here.

name: Little birch grove
description: Flat grassy place, invisible from the street, behind a birch grove and surrounded by fields.

name: gravel pits away from road
description: Can get away from the highway noise at these abandoned pits.  Access road: 53.9244, 121.1301

name: Camping Tridevyatoe Tsarstvo
description: Campground with phantastic overview over the river. Basic but clean facilities. Cooking place, terrace and living room. We payed 100 RUB for our car and 2 adults.

name: Fishermen‚Äòs Lake
description: Small lake with lots of grassy space. Unfortunately a little noisy due to near roads and a train station but nothing unbearable. In the evening and morning A LOT of friendly fishermen. Beeline 3G, MTS Edge.

name: Hide out behind the Datschas
description: Lot of space behind a field of Datschas. Nice water and view

name: Drinking water at truckstop
description: The Aba hotel have a point of drinking water. Only you must pay 30 rubli for the parking. The water is free.

name: Camping and bathing
description: A little too close to the road, but otherwise a good spot. Nice refreshing water, small pavilion, toilets. Flat areas for tents too.

name: Hotel "Blossom"
description:
It was OK on the first look, and we had long day cycling, so we stayed, despite the high price (1500 rub for two - no a.c., very old not comfortable small beds).
But... in the night... in the room started to smell like sewage. We asked in reception what is happened and may be they can do something with it, but lady told that it is usual smell for all their rooms. 
So... it was really bad! We can't open a window, because insects was coming to the light. No air, no.fresh air... Too horrible for this price. 
NEVER STAY ONE MORE TIME HERE!

name: Family camping by the river
description:
We decided to stop here as it was dark and raining. 
They charged something like 300 rubles for the night. There is no much facility except the little huts and fireplace.
Seems to be crowded on week-ends.

name: Remote spot next to dry river bed
description:
Just follow the track from the street for a couple of minutes
You will see a line of trees on this plateau. Leave the track whereever you like and find a nice levelled spot next to the trees and the dry river bed. Super quiet and firewood around. Place also accessible by 2wd. Windprotection could be a problem, but if you search long enough you might also find a good place for tents.

name: Etno Hostel
description:
Nice hostel in a big building. Seems not very inviting at first sight because there are some big houses around. There are a parking lot and a dead end where we finally could stay for the night (VW T4) directly infront of the entrance. No english, but people were really helpful and we could use shower, kitchen and toilet (all very clean and pretty new) for just 100 Rubel in total. Spot is not easy to find, but Google and maps.me are right. You have to take a very small road from the main road, find your way around these big buildings and you will find it. (Pics - also from the outside - on
 booking)

name: Streetcamping at the gardens
description: street camping right at the gardens and very close to the entrance, busy during the dat, nobody at night. There are shops and a bank nearby on the main street.

name: Vet Certificate
description: If you want to go abroad with your pet, visit first a state veterinary clinic (this one) and get a certificate "Form 1" here. At the airport you need to go to the veterinary control service and get with Form 1 the next Form 6a. At the airport they do not have the situation for animals that are born in another country than Russia, travelling or switching the means of travel. It took 1 hour at the first vet and 90 minutes at the second vet, and the second one at the airport did not speak a word English . So plan a lot of time ahead! They were satisfied with the European pet passport. Bring also a printed and signed (even if machine produced) printed original from titer Certificate. Good luck.

name: Beautiful place next to the city Chaikovsky
description: Beautiful place next to the city of Chaikovsky. Some locals but enough place so you could not see or hear them.

name: 4 Komnaty Inn
description: Very nice and clean rooms in the center of Ulan Ude. We parked our van behind the guesthouse. No breakfast but nearby a lot of breakfast bars. 1400R for one night. 100R for laundry. The owners are very kind but don't speak english. Shared bathroom but private toilet in the room.  We stayed  more than a week here.

name: Dostoevskiy Hostel
description:
Clean hostel with all amenities one might need (wifi, washing machine, etc). Double room with breakfast 1200 RUB.
They also have a big guarded parking lot in the back of the building.
Staff is friendly, helpful and speaks English. Foreigner registration was no problem.
Breakfast wasn‚Äôt great, we went to Proviant Bakery afterwards ;)

name: Hide out with water, trees
description: Hide out at the river Kama. Lot of trees. You can have a nice bonfire. Quite.

name: Sand beach at the other side of Novocheboksarsk
description: Sand beach, nice view, quite with some locals but they normally don‚Äôt stay over night. Lots of space.

name: Stolovaya N1
description:
Perfect! Menu of the day for 150 rubles. Include: soup, main dish, salad and drink. Every each position in day-menu is optional on your choice. 

Testy and fresh meal! 
Also, you can charge devices there, there is plugs on the spot. 

Nice girl was working on reception! 
Great!

name: Land Rover Nowosibirsk
description: Official Land Rover dealer and workshop.

name: Siberian Birch Museum
description: Small museum, more a gallery, of artwork made from birch bark.

name: River camping
description: You can either park right at the river on the pebble bank or on a big gravel lot just before. Road is audible in the far distance but otherwise very quiet. Few fishermen around who only care about their own business. Lots of firewood available and surprisingly few mosquitoes.

name: Clean sea campsite
description: Lot of space at a clean sea. Washing is possible and there are some trees for the clothe line. Some locals are around also in the early morning for fishing. There is a sign that swimming is not allowed. There is no problem with the water but I think the dam is to close. The dam is guarded by military but they and the locals are very friendly!

name: Steppe Oasis
description:
Here is a water station which sells filtered water. 1,8 Ruble per Litre.
Open every day from 8 am - till 6 pm

name: Hide out at the river Klyz‚Äôam
description: It is a longer way from the main road but it‚Äôs worth it. Very nice and quite spot. Some locals around for fishing. The river is not the best for swimming and washing.

name: Lake side
description: On the other side of the lake is the parking spot to go see the waterfall, which you can also reach by car if you own a good 4x4. The place is very popular for both tourists and campers, hence we prefered this place on the oposite side. Flat, quiet, fresh clear water and wood available and still a nice view. 4G available with MTC

name: Wild camp next to lake
description: At night, fairly private spot for wild camp (expect locals during the day). Tents ok. Lots of mosquitos. Fire pit from previous campers. Follow dirt track off main road, surrounded by wheat fields. Could be muddy in wet.

name: Above the canyon of the Berezovaya
description: Flat place overlooking the canyon of the Berezovaya River. Magnificent view. Fresh air in summer (elevation 1220m). Close to paved road (100m) but access may be difficult to vehicles with low ground clearance.

name: Wild camp beside the road
description: Wild camp site in an old quarry. Close to the road but wasn‚Äôt too loud. Nothing special but there‚Äôs not many marked camps through this area. Limited flat ground

name: Chulyshman River Camp Site
description: There are many camp sites along this river. Most have drop toilets and a small sheltered table. This marked spot is opposite a waterfall

name: Evgeny mechanic
description:
Aluminum welded an engine part and fixed our car. Has equipment for tire fitting as well.

He also hosted us inside his home to spend the night.

Great guy!

name: Tiny spot off the track here
description: space for one car to park off of the dirt track here. not sure where the track leads but was nice to hide away from the road for a bit.

name: Open area next to river
description: Flat and open next to river.  Beautiful.

name: Beautiful spot by river
description: Grateful view but a bit close to main road.  Out of sight mostly.

name: river spot
description: Track from highway leads to flat area with fire pit.  River was murky when I was here.

name: Kadykchan abdandoned city
description: Spent an afternoon exploring some buildings in this square.  Sure there's lots more to explore.  Dead silent, abandoned, and beautiful.

name: Old gravel pit
description: Follow the(rough) track from the highway to this flat and open spot.

name: Flat tundra spot
description: Turn south off the main road onto a smaller road and then turn right onto the tracks (bumpy).  Follow until flat area with soft mosses.

name: Car insurance KAZ and RUS
description: Car insurance in private house. Abt 15% cheaper as directly at the border.

name: Ostrovnoye Lesnichestvo National Park Office
description: Here you can buy the permit for the national park which starts just north of the village. 450 for 2 persons and one car for 2 nights. Rangers drive through the national park and check the permit.

name: Velikoye Ozero
description: Holiday camp with room for tents and campers next to the lake. Whole camp is quite big, and also has houses. We paid 400 roebel for 2 people, 1 car and 1 night. Since the holiday season hadn't started yet, we where the only ones in the camp.

name: Pingvin hotel & restaurant
description:
After two weeks of rain and cold we needed a place to stay and we found this strange hotel, restaurant and kids-playground all in one. The whole town looked rather shady, but inside is was nice and clean. A double room will cost 1700 roebel.

There is a big gated parking area around the hotel, and the guard will close the gate at 22:00.

name: Pomyanennyy Kamen'
description:
Nice hike towards the top of Pomyanennyy Kamen'. There is a big sign where to start.

For 1,5 kilometer you'll follow a 4x4 path - be careful, we got terrible stuck here! After that the trail follows a small creek. Because of the rain and cold, the creek turned the whole area into a big swamp, so we got incredible wet and turned around halfway, since we wouldn't see any views because of the fog.

name: Land Rover Dealer - Planeta Auto
description: Shiny Land Rover and Jaguar dealer. They obviously have seen more overlanders asking for help. Although they barely spoke English, they sourced a shock absorber for our Defender. The dealer also has a big garage in the back.

name: Shockaborber shop - Dom Amortizator
description:
Shop that sells loads of different shockaborbers, from Russian brands to EU brands - we saw some Monroes, Koni's and Biltsteins. Although they don't have many EU brands in stock, they can order it in Moscow. 

Downstairs there is a nice shop that will change your shock aborbers for some 20 euro's.

name: Stone city / Devils town
description: Very nice trip into the woods of the Ural. It's roughly 1 kilometer pass the parking area, then you'll reach the stone city / devils town. The huge boulders resemble an ancient city and through the thick forest they're almost invisible. Entrance is free.

name: Waterfall campsite
description: Next to a small waterfall - guided with concrete slabs - is a small campsite. You'll see a sigh with 'Palatka'. We stayed 1 night - 1 car/rooftop tent and 2 people - for a price of 400 roebels. Toilets are clean and there is a banja on sight, at extra costs. Owner is very friendly, but doesn't speak English. She phoned a friend who translated.

name: on the hills next to the lake
description: Quite place with beautyful sunset, 1,5 km from the mainroad

name: hike to Zyuratkul range - peak
description:
Just before you enter the village of Zyuratkul, you'll see a wooden arch on your right hand. This is the start of a beautiful hike up the Zyuratkul range. The first few kilometers is over a boardwalk, later you'll have to scramble yourself a way up the mountain. Beautiful views over the lake and it's a nice easy hike. 

Two-way trip wil take around 4-5 hours. This is also the hike mentioned in the Lonely planet.

name: Border KAZ-RUS
description: KAZ was quick. Waited 2 hours on Russian border. All officers were correct, nothing to pay. Need your entry certificate for Eurasian Economic Union for your car. For us was from Kyrgyzstan.

name: Volgograd beach
description: Wild camping right next to the Volga river. Lots of trees and access to the river through a sandy way. Quiet place with some locals coming from time to time during the day. Quiet place at night. Lots of spots for BBQ.

name: Grachi
description: Close to the small village of Grachi, a nice camp ground by the lake. Very quiet (no dog barking because far enough from the center village but lots of mosquitos !

name: Petrovskoye
description: Next to the church, there a grassy spot to stay over for one night. Not far from the Highway but still quiet.

name: Water source
description: Several taps along the road. On both sides of the road.

name: gaz station
description: Easy refilling of gas bottles, last before Mongolia

name: Cape Kharaldai
description: Close to the cliff. Beautiful sand beach down the cliff.  CAREFUL!!  Not too close to the edge because the edge is unstable! Don't park your car too close the the cape proper  because this is the spot where tour groups stop in the morning for a short time to enjoy the view. They will not bother you.  From the place you have a splendid view on the lake

name: Barbaris Hostel
description: Nice place in a quiet area with a secured parking where we could stay and sleep. Toilet, shower, WiFi ... everything in a very good condition as the place seems pretty new. Supermarket and also city center in walking distance. Payed 200 R per person per night.

name: Europe / Asia marker
description: This is the new marker, made by the city. It's a tiny, tiny sort-of Eiffeltower. There seem to be plans to make a big one, but in juni 2018, we didn't see it. Honestly not even worth the stop, if you really want to stand on the 'border',visit the older marker in the west.

name: Older Europe / Asia marker
description: Older Europe / Asia marker compared to the newer 'Eiffeltower' in the east. If you can / will only visit 1 marker, visit this one: it's more beautiful and the wooded area around is also more attractive.

name: Lake Peipsi
description: Offroad track to lake Peipsi. No facilities, very scenic site.

name: rossa truck mechanic
description: mechanical for truck, any type of repair, machining part, very good home, very helpful, find the best solution cheaper, speak little english,

name: Central Airforce Museum
description:
It's one of the biggest airforce museums in the world with over 170 airplanes on display. Entrance fee is 250 roebel per person. 

There are 2 hangers with planes from the early days of aviaton until the WW2, there are some English signs. The main attraction is the huge grassfield with rows and rows of different - 99% Soviet - warplanes, from jetplanes to bombers and helicopters. All the planes are well maintained - compared to other 'museums' - and every row is a specific category or brand of planes, so you see the evolution of certain types of planes. Great museum for an hour or 2, and nice to see the planes from really close, highlight are the biggest helicopter in the world, the Russian Concorde, TU-95 and lots of MIG's and MIL's.

name: Ignatievka Cave
description: In this cave old rock paintings are found. The whole area is beautiful and the entrance of the cave hangs dramaticly over the river, but it's very hard to reach. Because of the rain we got stuck, and walked the last 2 kilometer. Unfortunately the cave was also closed with a gate, so we wouldn't recommend visiting if you don't have a guide of a key. The whole area is also a nice place to do some proper offroading.

name: greenland
description: Just few 100 meters off a little cafe and small village. Beside the street

name: Water House
description: Water house with free clear water from a short tube.

name: Dondi Yurt 'Museum'
description:
Quite an amazing place. All build and maintained by Mr Adam. We spent a while there with him and he turned out to be the main attraction of this home museum. 
Very interesting experience even though we had to rely on Google translate to communicate with him!

name: Discreet bivouac by the river
description:
Hidden away spot by the river near Urus-Martan. 
Not much water, but looked and felt very clean.
Also, not far from Dondi-Yurt museum.

name: Parking by the lake
description:
A big parking area by the lake. There are several fast food joints. Pit toilets also available.
Interesting fact is that there are both a church and a mosque around that small lake.

name: Free parking in center
description:
We did not sleep here, but parked our camper longitudinally under the trees. If your rig is not too high it should fit here!
This spot is convenient to visit Lenin Square, Golden Gate and Chipollino ;-)

name: Bivouac in the dry steppe
description:
We got there at night and according to Google Maps there should have been a lake in this 'State Nature Reserve'. The only things we found were wind and a dry lake.
So unless you miss Iran in August, I cannot really recommend this area lol

name: Parking at some sport complex
description:
We fist parked down the village near the beach next to the bar and the bungalows. But it was quite noisy and we were just scared to be waken up by the muezzin calls at night (as in Grozny).
So I drove up the village as far as I could and found this spot. It looks like a sport complex, not sure it is already open.
Anyway, the night was quiet and great views in the morning.

name: Water tap in front of school
description: We didn't drink this water. but filled up a small tank and it looked very clean.

name: Noah's Ark!
description:
We saw some signs on the road and out of curiosity we drove all the way up this location. There is some excavation going on. Not sure what's inside as the scaffolding didn't look so safe at all, so we didn't venture inside the hole.
There is one Dagestan shepherd who lives there in the summer in his caravan.
2 days later, we found out that his name is Mr Labazan and he is the father of a family we stayed with in Aslanta village!

More info here:
https://ktelegram.com/on-the-border-of-chechnya-and-dagestan-was-found-noahs-ark/2931/

https://ktelegram.com/chechen-found-in-the-mountains-of-noahs-ark/6103/

name: Bivouac with panoramic views on terraced mountain
description:
Very nice spot with amazing views. Unfortunately, we drove down the Aslanta to buy some food and could not drive up the same rocky road with our 2WD camper.
In the end we slept here:  42.683939, 46.102614

name: Bivouac in the filed with panoramic views
description: Since our 2WD camper did not manage to drive back up the rocky road to our first bivouac, we slept here. The views are amazing too.

name: Excellent discreet bivouac by the river
description:
This spot was so amazing that we stayed 2 nights there. It is right by the river, sheltered by a small forest in the back. Lots of dry firewood, good MTS internet signal to get some online work done. The only downside was some trash lying around, so we did pick as much as we could.
Easily accessible even for camping cars. From the main road, take the right path down then turn left at the river.

name: Go for a swim
description: There are plenty of more hidden spots around the lake in the trees, but we camped in the center, down near the shore. Plenty of people picknicking by day (it was a Saturday), a couple of people fishing and walking their dogs in the morning, but no one during the night. Some noise from passing trains, so might not be suitable for light sleepers. The water is great for a morning swim.

name: Toyota official dealer.
description: Open every day even on Sunday. Good service

name: Engine block and cylinder workshop
description: They recommended a mechanic to take care of our broken head gasket. We went back to have work done on the cylinder head and valves.

name: Cummins
description: Many part shops inside a larger building. Our mechanic from XADO (also on the map) had a discount card. Payment by card available.

name: Metal workshop
description: Our mechanic from Xado went here to have some larger engine valves adjusted to smaller dimensions. The workshop is on the right hand side of the building.

name: Lake camp
description: Around the lake are several spots. This one was the most flat. In the evening and early morning there are also some fishermen around.

name: Roadhouse Cafe and Bar
description: Nice little rest stop with some lodging nearby. WiFi, food, coffee, and decent squat toilets.

name: Very nice Hotel
description:
Very nice Hotel, was too cold for camping so we looked for a hotel instead. We found this one which we really liked. Everything is new, friendly staff, very nice rooms, breakfast available for 150 rupias pp. all rooms have flat screen tv, and a balcony with a nice view. 
We paid 1300 for a twin room, you can book it on booking.com as well but it is slightly more expensive

name: Hotel Red
description:
Cheap accommodation, 1400RUB per double room, per day. They also have dorms. Rooms can be booked for half a day and the check-in time is late in the evening.

Room was clean and tidy and there was hot water for showering.

Large parking in front of the 24/7 reception.

name: Guest House Altargana
description:
Hey travellers!
Mega impressed by this place. It was pouring with rain and we were soaked and cold (on a motorcycle) so we saw this place and stopped for some food. The restaurant was super cheap and delicious. 
We asked for a room and they charged us 15USD for two people for our own private place and it's amazing! couldn't be happier. private bathroom and hot shower, cosy wooden cabin, sofa, big comfy bed and super clean. and there's a gated safe area for our motorcycle. 
this place was an incredible find. super happy with it and would definitely recommend! 
happy travels
www.madornomad.com

name: Iron Angels Bike Post
description:
Hey travellers!
this is the iron angels bike post. it's basically a Russian biker club with super friendly people. we arrived in this town late at night and in the rain and all four hotels were fully booked. we found this place and the owner Alexander let us sleep in the upstairs part of his club house. it's frequented a lot by motorcycle travellers as there's three full guest books! 
the guys made us food and gave us vodka. I believe they can also help with bike fixing as they have a garage in the same building. 
very friendly, very hospitable, stop in and say hey! 
I believe they've hosted motorcyclists and cyclists. 
This is basic accomodation, expect a sofa in a club house and an outside toilet. 

happy travels

name: Easy bushcamp
description: Follow the dirt road and find a lot of nice overlandig places. Road leads you through a small forest to a open grass area, lake and fields. Choose the best place for you, there are many options. You can also drive further than this point if the street noise disturbs you. Only the first meters are bumpy but the rest is easy to drive. No houses as far as we can see. Only a hunter came by.

name: Wild camp without noise
description: Follow this track (not to the lake, there is a resort) to find several camp spaces. Easy to reach and the best: quiet! No street noise here!

name: Ferry is not working
description:
You have to take a ferry over this side arm of the Wolga. When we were there the ferry was not operating, and it did not look as it will operate again soon.
There is a way around the side arm which takes about another 200km, so we decided to drive back to Saratow and take the highway because the road on this side is not very good.

name: Jury Gagarin landing location after he was the first man in space
description: Here is a nice monument of Jury Gagarin and his space ship at the location where he landed in 1961.

name: Hotel Rayskiy Ugolok
description:
this is a spotlessly clean hotel, with fast WiFi private bathroom and shower, super comfortable double bed for 2000RUB for two people. it may be cheaper for one person, not sure if they charge by the room or person. anyway, we were two. she originally showed me a room without a toilet, I asked for one with a toilet and shower and it was the same price. 
there's a market downstairs which is also a little cafe, they may great cakes and serve some hot food. 
there's parking behind the hotel.
you can also use their little kitchen 
would definitely recommend 
happy travels!
www.madornomad.com

name: Kazakh and Russian Insurance
description: The first place you come to where your can buy vehicle insurance.

name: Road side spring
description: Very popular road side spring. There was a bit of a queue.

name: Small lake close to Sergiyev Posad
description: Nice lake surrounded by trees. Locals fish and swim in the lake, but all in all very quiet. Containers to leave your trash in. Big rigs might have trouble navigating through the trees to get here.

name: Water pump
description: If you're staying at the lake and need fresh water, there's a water pump here.

name: Trinity Lavra of St. Sergius
description: I've been told this is to the Russian Orthodox Church what the Vatican is to Roman Catholicism. Well worth a detour on your way between Moscow and Saint Petersburg.

name: Avtograd
description: Car parts mall with many stores, you can find anything here, including service stations. Many other stores nearby, supermarkets etc. Huge car park.

name: New truck stop
description: Completely new truckers parking with motel, bagna and so on. Wasn‚Äôt even completely open when we parked there. Not sure how save this region (behind the big region checkpoint) is so this was a good stop. First we tried a gravel road but there were people with normal cars and guns on the road so we turned around and decided to park in this secured truck stop. At night there was a guard with a machine gun..... costs 200rubli for parking, toilet is 20.

name: In the forest near the river
description: A very nice spot a bit further from Burinskaya datcha. It‚Äôs more hidden and calm! Good access, but maybe not ideal for big rigs because of the height of the trees and the small flated area. The site is directly at a little pond and only some meters from the river.

name: Very angry and unpleasant cops
description: We were stopped here and they were trying to find anything that we had done wrong. In the end they said party of our number plate was covered and that this meant that they would have to confiscate our documents for 3 months (rather difficult on a 5 day transit visa). They got very aggressive and intimidation and shouty. We held firm and stood our ground, and after about 1 hour they got very frustrated and told us to go. But it was not a nice experience.

name: Motel/ Cafe Bastak
description:
Hey travellers!
If you're on the way to/from Vladivostok and don't have time to spend going into the town of Birobidzhan to look for a hotel then this Motel is a well-worth stop for the night. 
it's right on th main road so you don't need to turn off but has secure parking behind locked gates for motorcycles and rigs. 
The rooms are basic but cheap. we paid 1500RUB for a large double room with private bathroom and shower for two people.. A room with a shared toilet and shower is 1000. 
The rooms are clean, have a TV and fridge. 
One of the best things is the cafe downstairs. They have a decent menu and make a mean soup. 
it's a very a handy stop for the night if you're just passing through and need somewhere to eat and sleep.
happy travels!
www.madornomad.com

name: DBS ferry vehicle drop off
description:
hey travellers
If you're taking the boat to Japan or SK you'll be need to take your bike/car here and drop it off the day before. You will need to leave whatever luggage you don't want to take with you on the boat on your bike as you won't be allowed to go back to it again that day or the next. not sure if you're allowed access once you're on the boat. the staff don't know for sure as they say the rules change. 
if you're with Yuri and Links they'll take you here. leave your vehicle (with the key)  sign some papers and then they will take you to customs. show your passport, back to this place, pay Yuri and then come back the next day to the tall building which is by the car park and go to the DBS office and get your ticket. Get there early as it gets busy. 
happy travels!
www.madornomad.com

name: Permit needed for border zone
description: We wanted to take some last Russian backroads to the Estonian border, but the guards at this checkpoint sent us back to the main road.

name: Krapivin
description: Bungalows with camping space for van. Very clean bungalows. Toilet, bath and kitchen can be used. Price to be discussed. We paid 1000 RUB for staying in our van but using the bungalows shower and toilet. Nice owner.

name: Near the Sarykum Sand Dune
description: There are plenty of spots on the way to the Dune. We camped near trees bit there is also a river on the other side of the track where you can camp (it‚Äôs more exposed on the river side) Very quiet only a few shepards here during the day.

name: Bautiful camp by the river
description: Taking a right (heading towards Kasachstan) from the road by an abandoned gasstation towards the river. The road after the right turn is quite narrow but still doable with a big rig. Very quiet here, only one or two fisherman around

name: Chirkey Dam bivouac
description: Very scenic spot by the lake. We got there on a Saturday and there were already few fishermen. Since we were dying for some privacy, we decided to skip this nice location and push on a little more along the Sulak river.

name: Hotel Zolotaya Imperiya
description: Well centered hotel with secure parking. There is a gate and security guys 24h. The rooms are very 'classic' and/but comfy. There is a bar in the restaurant that serves all kind of alcohol.

name: Bivouac in the mountains
description: The only reason we stopped here is because it was pitch dark and the road is pretty bad in this area. We found that flat spot a little sheltered from the road. Well, not sheltered enough, at 1:45am 4 guys knocked on the camper. They insisted, so I eventually half-opened a window. Tried to have a conversation with one of the guy while one of his friend were shooting a gun just few meters away! Not exactly an area I can recommend. Can't remember what I told them, but in the end they left. Not our best night for sure.

name: Barakat Restaurant
description: Clean restaurant serving traditional dishes. Located just on the main square.

name: Parking central Gunib
description: Large flat parking area in the center of the village. Toilets available behind Barakat restaurant.

name: Bivouac just outside Chokh
description: This bivouac turned out to be much better than it initially looked when we first arrived in the evening. Very quiet, Mr Uzair (the owner) was super friendly and even seemed really happy to have guests parking next to his house :-)

name: Ethno Dom
description:
Amazing guesthouse in the old village of Chokh. The owner, designer and builder, 'Zaur' has renovated every part of this house with taste and respect for traditions. 
Rooms are about 1600 Rubles for 2 persons.
The view from the terrace is breathtaking. Highly recommended.

name: Chokh resto
description:
Seemed to be the only restaurant in the village.
Mme Raazad cooked tasty local food for us. She turned out to be the mum of 'Zaur', the designer of Ethno Dom hostel ;-)

name: Excellent bivouac by the river
description:
Not too far from the road, but still super quiet as it is sheltered by a small wood and the sound of the river covers any others.
No mosquito.
Also a good base to visit Gamsutl

name: Gamsutl abandoned village
description:
The Machu-Picchu of Dagestan, Amazing site. 
Takes about 1h walk to reach from the parking.

name: Drinking water spring
description: A welcome stop on the way up to Gamsutl. The water looks clean, tastes good and soooo refreshing!

name: Small parking (only 4x4)
description: If your vehicle is small and 4x4, you can drive up here. If not, just park it down at  42.308038, 47.001315

name: Alcohol shop
description: Apart from the Cognac factory, this is one the rare shops we have seen that sells alcohol in the area

name: Cognac and Champagne factory
description: We could not visit the inside of the factory as they were closed for the week-end, but the shop was open and they sell a plethora of Cognacs, Champagnes, glasses, ...

name: Bivouac on the beach
description:
Bivouac right on the beach with toilets. No shade though! 
There is a 'resort' just next to it and it is possible to use their beach showers. Very friendly resort owners, we ended up partying the whole night with them and their guests ...

name: Naryn-Kala bivouac
description:
Free parking right behind the UNESCO Naryn-Kala. 
Quiet at night. No mosquito. No shade. Low MTS signal.
There is a back door to the fortress, but it cannot be used as an entrance.

name: Restaurant Yadula
description:
Definitively the best chicken Shashlik we have ever had.
Mr Yadula and his staff are amazing cooks. He also prepares excellent mulberry tea.
Big parking available in front of the restaurant. Great views from the terraces.
Mr Yadula even accepted to host a baby cat with a bad eye that I had just rescued on a busy road in central Derbent!  If you stop by this restaurant, please give the kitty a hug from me!!

name: Salta Canyon waterfall
description:
Very nice canyon with a small waterfall in the cave at the end.
Mornings seem to be a lot less busy.
Bring some water shoes as you will have to walk through ankle-deep water to reach the cave.
Park your vehicle here:  42.393858, 47.068027

name: Parking for Salta Canyon Waterfall
description:
Park your vehicle here and walk through the canyon (5mn)
Bring some water shoes as you will have to walk through ankle-deep water to reach the cave.

name: At the riverbank
description: Great, quiet place at the river, on the edge of a birch forest. Enough flat ground for tents and campers. Firewood around. Great view over the river! We camped a bit further up the path because we arrived in the darkness and we found this beautiful spot in the morning.

name: Hotel Comfort
description:
Good place to stop in Chita, big places for parking. I think you can this place in booking.com,
Large room, shared toilet, there‚Äôs a kitchen available also.

name: 4x4 Garage
description:
Decent 4x4 workshop. Vladimir and his guys mainly work on UAZ here, but there are also Defenders here and they did a good job on our 70s Land Cruiser. Hands on.

Our Russian is terrible and their English is not much better but they have Russian friends in several countries to call and translate ;)

garage4x4.ru

name: Riverside between trees
description:
A very nice place next to the river. Quiet at day and night. Enough space for big rigs and nice grassy for ground tents. Accessible by a small dirt track from the road (500m).
Good MTS RUS 3G connection.

name: Kafe Dolphin
description: Really cute family owned kafe/shahslik with very nice food. try the borscht, it is the best I had in 6 months in central asia ! also very good meat not too fatty. there is plenty kafe/shashlik around that stretch of the road but this place was very nice and clean and the family who runs it is lovely !

name: autocombinat
description: big parking for public buses, but they also have big garage for bus and vans - we repaired our resor spring (we had spare part, they don't have any) in our ducato-camper. 1000RUBaa

name: car parts
description: we found here parts for our fiat, which was impossible in half of Asia:)

name: Lakeshore
description: Very beautiful spot directly at a lake, surrounded by birches. Easy access, very quiet, could be that in summer there are also some locals or fishermen. Beeline E-3G coverage.

name: Beach camp lake
description:
Beautiful lakeside camp. There are many fire places, so with a bit of luck you'll find wood to make a fire. Some fisherman use this spot to get into their boats. The lake is very clear and the water is fresh, so
 you can swim or use it for a shower as we did. Not hidden from the small dirtroad, but nobody bothered us.

name: Wide meadow
description: Arround 1km beside the main road there are wide meadows, where you find many options at the edge of the woods to place your car or tent. You still here the noise of the road. Beeline coverage 3G.

name: Gazprom: gas cylinder refill
description:
This guy at the Gazprom station had an adaptor to fill even our Campingaz cylinder (German fitting) - propane though, no butane.

60 rubels for 5 liters.

name: safe parking
description:
Safe parking (platnaja awtostojanka)
quite at night
150 Rubel / 24 hours

name: official Mercedes and Fuso workshop
description:
official Mercedes and Fuso Workshop for Trucks and Sprinter (Vario, 508 etc.)
good Work, fair prices

name: Diesel service
