description: Great machanics, great team. They tested our dieselpump and did a compression test. Good knowledge and equipment for diesel engine. No english spoken but they are very patience with Google translate.

name: River Camping
description: Next to the street there is a official picknick spot where you can camp. Only few people during the day (out of season) and nobody at night. There is an old lorry trailer which is actualy a sauna. Bring your own wood, only few around. There are some sheltered tables and e pit toilets. A beautiful spot. No MTS connection.

name: water house
description: There are plenty of water points in town but this is one. Clear water for free.

name: Small forest near from a river
description: Very quiet place in a small forest near from a river. Close from the main road but we don't hear it so much during the night. Not specialy flat ground

name: Wrong way to Mars
description: We followed the gsp from Ortolyk to go to Mars in Altai, but that was a bad idea. You really need a 4x4 to go this way. But we spend a very good night here with a wonderful view. Someone came just to know if everything was ok.

name: View on the river
description:
Flat spot near from a river. Unfortunately close to the road which can be noisy. The dirty road is leading to a small beach but was a little bit difficult with lot of big holes and muddy because it was rainy. So we spend the night before the beach.
Next day, it was even hard to go out of the dirty road...really not a good idea if you don't have a 4x4.

name: Makk garage open until 22.00
description:
Very friendly and helpfull. Even if they don't speak english, they use a translator to understand your needs.
They could have our spare parts in the hour (citro√´n jumper) and they worked more than 2 hours until almost 22.00 for a very cheap price. Highly recommended

name: –í–æ—è–∂ Hostel
description: Very nice new hostel with kind personnel. Safe carpark in front of hostel. Maybe even possible to sleep in your car, but we didn't because rooms are inexpensive. The city is certainly worth a visit with view of the Chinese city of Heihe all within walking distance from hostel.

name: Baikalskoye Cliff Viewpoint
description: Amazing viewpoint overlooking Lake Baikal and part of the small village of Baikalskoye. Just drive through the village and past the church (bend left), then follow the offroad trails to the location. You might need a 4x4 depending on the weather

name: camping near a river
description: beautiful site next to a river with plenty of space

name: overnight parking next to a church
description: Massive parking  area next to Alexander Nevsky Cathedral, just across the river is the city centre and main attractions. Stadium is very close. Would suit self-suffienct campers.

name: Parking
description: We parked at this location overnight walking distance to all major attraction, though noisy throughout the night.

name: Cathedral of Assumption
description: Great historical place in centre of town and lots of other places within walking distance. We parked two large expedition vehicles behind the Cathedral for several nights (free). Make sure you park on the grass/dirt area on the right hand side up against the wall. Don't drive through the gate as the gate will be locked at night. Fast internet if you have your own Sim card.

name: overnight parking near metro.
description: This place allows overnight parking for a small fee. (500 rub. per 24hr.) The parking lot is fenced and gates are monitored. The metro to Moscow centre is only a 10 minute walk from here.

name: Prachechnaya Samoobsluzhivaniya
description: Self-service laundry is located in the lower level of the  shopping centre. Access is via shopping centre and car park. Car parking is available in the streets surrounding the shopping centre. The laundry is very clean and contains washers and dryers.

name: Beautiful campsite next to a lake
description: This is a very nice and quiet spot next to a lake. You can camp all along the side of the lake. Just turn off the main road follow a small road until you come to the dam wall there is a caretaker tell him you like to camp on the other side of the lake as it is a dead end road. He will let you pass then drive across to the other side and take the first track on your left find yourself a nice spot. Happy camping, we stayed there for 4 days.

name: Scenic road in Altai Republic
description: Autumn colors and spectacular scenery for this whole river valley drive must be one of our top ten, the road is good and go slow to enjoy.

name: At the waterdam
description: We took the coordinates a bit late, so from this point you have to drive around 800 meters further on. You have two possibilities, you can either drive on the dam or on the path below. After about 500 meters you can turn left down the dam to a meadow. Take care the path from the dam to left is quite steep but possible to drive. The path below can be muddy when it rains. But the spot is great! Quite and surrounded by a little creek. Enough dry wood around for a campfire.

name: Khabarovsk
description: Water point in center of town. clear and free.

name: Insurance for RU, KZ and KGZ
description: When entering Russia, just on your left hand side is a small hut where they sell insurances. Very nice lady, offers tea and coffee while you wait. They have a sheet with everything translated she needs to know, so communication is very easy.

name: Police says "no foreigners area"
description:
Stopped again for the third time in the last few hours and less than half a mile from the previous stop.
Told there was a problem, I shouldn‚Äôt be on that road although they never gave me a reason why and they must take me to the station to arrange to deport me.
Explained I was in my way to Georgia and also said I would turn round and go a different route. Still no good.
Finally I was speaking to our embassy in Moscow on my phone when they decided to shoo me along.
Still don‚Äôt know why I was not supposed to be on that road!

name: Altai historic ethnic museum
description: Historic museum, big garden with sculptures also. In Front the garden a big parking place where you can stay over night. Big rigs no problem.

name: Apart Hotel Loft
description:
Apart Hotel with cozy Rooms for 2 until 4 Persons. Available in the Room is: Small Kitchen, Microwave and own Bathroom. Washing machine shared with all rooms ( 8 ) and for free. Free WiFi

Cars also high cars (our was 2.60m high ) can park for free in the courtyard with automatic door on the street side. So you have a secured parking near middle of the city. Perfect place to stay there. Lovely Owner ( Igor )

Price was +/- 1'500RUB per Night for two Persons

name: @Lake
description: Gravel Place direct on the lake. Small Road but nothing special. Fireplace there

name: Near Lake
description: Grill Place in the Forest near the Lake Border. Good small Road, better with 4x4. Fireplace is there

name: Rivercamping with fireplace
description:
A very nice place, even in winter. There is a lot of wood around and a fireplace. Follow the track till the end. Maybe 4x4 required. Depends on weather.
MTS & MegaFon connection 3G

name: Lake view
description: Nice place at the end of the road next to a small lake. You can hear the train the whole night but not to loud. Poor 2G connection with MTS and MegaFon.

name: Kafe Gostinitsa
description: Charming little roadside cafe and motel. We were glad to find this driving in awful weather at night. We paid 2000 rubles for a clean double room with v good shower, and 400 rubles for hearty meal for two.

name: Fitness Center
description: The Fitness Center here offers camping next to the soccer field. Not far from the Metro. Good place to stay several days. 1.500 RUB for one car and 2 adults.

name: Valday national park campsite
description: Gps coordinates provided to us by the staff of the national park. Probably not lots of facilities.

name: Picnic spots next to a river
description: Several picnic / camp spots along the river. Looks like there are some people in summer around. When we were there nobody came by. You can hear the road and the industry Good internet with MTS and MegaFon.

name: DIY Mechanic and Carwash
description:
This is the place from Cobaclub.ru
They rent out auto-hoists (car elevator) for 400 Rub per hour. They are very friendly and helpful. Right in front of their workshop is a self car wash station. Also about 400 rub per hour. We prepared our car here for shipping to australia.

name: Cheap student dorm
description: One of the cheapest hotels you can find around Saint Petersburg. 650 RUB for a room with a bed. Shared showers and shared toilets, very clean though.

name: off the road in the bush
description:
Small campsite in the bushes at 20 meters from the road. Several dirt roads leads off the main road. Lot of space, some tree to be covered from swing,  but not from the noise (not to loud if you go further from the road). OK for van and tents, no need for 4WD.
a little bit trashy, but not to much. spend one good night here !

name: R 21 road
description: Parking near petrolstation. price 90 roebel. With small restaurant.

name: Nordcamp Belomorsk
description: Camping and hotel. With banja. Quiet place.

name: Loukhi
description: Parking near petrolstation and restaurant. Just good for one night.

name: on the road to Teriberka
description: Spot near the road. Almost no traffic at night. Nice view.

name: Near the river
description: Nice place near the lake and close to the road R 21. Nice view.

name: on the road to Zapolvarny R 21
description: Parking next to road. Huge place.  Nothing special. Lake 10 m1.

name: Verkhnetulomskiy,  road 47A-057
description: Close to Verkhnetuloomskiy. Place very close to the lake. Nice view over the lake.

name: Murmansk. on the road to Teriberka
description: 15 km from Murmansk, on the road to Teriberka. Huge place near the lake.

name: Umba-Varzuga
description: On the road from Umba to Varzuge, 25 km for Varzuga. Close to the White sea.

name: Repino
description: Just outside Repino. Parking close to the beach, 50 m1.

name: Velikiy Novgorod
description:
Parking infront of the tourist office and very close to the Kremlin. Paid parking. 
Lots of resturants.

name: Backpack Hostel
description:
Very friendly hostel with free parking. You feel like at home very quickly !
450 roubles per night with breakfast.

you have to go in the courtyard, once you're inside go on the left. The entry is after a tiny open air corridor.

name: Wild Camp at Curch
description: Nice place by the river next to an old church

name: Guarded parking
description: guarded parking in UFA center. Shopping arcades right next door and also a supermarket. after consultation with the boss, 500 rub per night. The main road is direct at the place but its relatively quiet in the night.

name: Wild Camp at Katun
description: Nice place at Katun, 4x4 is important. Some places at Katun.

name: Water Pump in a Village
description: Fresh cold water with a hand pumping. In a village Next to Baikal

name: Camp in Forest
description: Campsite in the forest. Sandy road, no problem to find the place. Next to a village and the river.

name: Pskov Design Apartments
description:
The Hostel is at the end of building 5a. New, fresh and clean. The lady can not speak English but will use her computer to translate. 8 beds per room. In January 2019 500 R per night.
Secure parking for all size vehicles.

name: Permit required for visiting Dargavs
description: There is an interesting sight called Dargavs- city of death, a nekropole from the 14th century. Nice to explore, but: as a foreigner you need a special permit to visit this border area. If the border control catches you while you are there, you will be escorted to the next police station, leave your fingerprints, pay a fine at the bank and it will take some hours. The military and police guys were very nice, absolutely correct but it‚Äôs not worth the hassle. We asked them where one gets this special permit - but nobody knew. There were no military checkpoints but they are patrolling.

name: Truck Stop
description: Truck stop just at the main road. Parking overnight 150 Rubel. Available is a restaurant, toilets and also hotel rooms.

name: West Vladikavkaz
description: A little place off grass not too close to the road. For 4x4 easy but for other i don‚Äôt know. We HAD a quiet night there.

name: Near Grozny
description: Little place of grass not to close of the road on the suburbs of Grozny. Not very clean but the people we met were very kind.

name: nord biakal view point
description: lots of parking next to the nord biakal monument/view point. not many people about. stunning views.

name: Riverside  camping
description: Tons of parking. stayed here two nights and nobody minds. lots of cars and fishermen come and go. Can Park in the parking area or 4x4 access to the "beach" by the river.

name: Deer Monument
description: great views from the top of the hillside. plenty of parking although not many flat spots. deer monument and two religious/spiritual sites are nice. If you drive down the other side I think you get to the river. access is steep, in wet conditions, a 4x4 would be essential

name: Hostels Rusk Tomsk
description: Brand-new and centrally located hostel. Modern facilities, very clean and super friendly staff! The manager also speaks German and is very helpful. You can park the car in front of the hostel. A double room is only 1000 Rubel. Cheap dorm beds are available, too.

name: Truck Stop with good showers
description: Just another truck stop, but there are really good showers worth the 150 RUB. Parking 100 RUB. There is also a restaurant.

name: Rig Service - for big rigs
description: they are partner of Scania, MAN, Volvo, Webasto and Donaldson. ...but they also did their best to help us with our Mercedes. Really nice guys

name: Pole of cold - Oymyakon
description:
The sign of Oymyakon, Pole of Cold. We parked here over night. No one seemed to bother. 
There are three different monument parks dotted around the village.

name: Storage room for vehicles max. 3.90m high
description:
if need to get your vehicle inside for a few hours or a night because of the cold, this is a good place. 
Ivan runs the place, he also has a hostel but speaks no English 
+7 914 226-05-40 is his number

name: Tomtor
description: Only fuel station in the area. We payed cash but we think you can also pay with card. the price was the same as in Jakutsk.

name: Mercedes Trucks and Kamaz Garage
description:
Official MB truck garage. 
Very nice owner, Alexandr, who also has a translator to make sure everything is understood correctly.

name: Platfrom with view over Yakutsk
description: Near a powerplant, there is a big parking lot with a platfrom to look over the whole city. you can probably sleep here too

name: –ë–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫–∞ Lounge & Cafe - amazing food!
description:
the food here is amazing! They have sushi, pizza, steak... 
The owner speaks english and will welcome you with open arms.
It's a hip young place, also bar at night. Go up the stairs into the small establishment.

name: Free water - Connection to the water system
description: there are many other pump stations like this one, but its easy to find and not in the middle of town. Very convenient

name: Babr Burger -  Sibirian Burgers
description: very young, hip Burger place with plenty of parking spots along the road. Worth a visit of you haven't had a good burger or a burger at all for a while :)

name: Mercedes Truck Service
description: Great garage, very friendly and fast working staff. They ordered parts in over the weekend. Also good prices. very recommendable.

name: Vianor Truck - Tire Service
description: Truck tire service close to the main road. Fast workers and faire prices.

name: Gostinitsa "Gostevoy Dvor"
description:
Accommodation with large parking,  partly covered, with locked gate.Enough space fur multiple vehicles. Rooms spacious and clean with private bathroom. Communal space with water cooker etc. (also one in the room). 1000 Rubles for 1 person in a 3 beds dorm, which I had to myself. 
Friendly little coastal town; a world apart from the area south from here. A gas station and supermarket just around the corner. Beware: you won't find any accommodation for a while when traveling in the direction of Makhachkala. Empty, hadden landscape with loooooots of wind, straight and boring roads but splendid tarmac.

name: Tula
description: Great parking at the shopping center. Only 1.5 km to the Kremlin. We stayed overnight.

name: River Camping
description: Nice spot away from the road for a nights camping. few other locals picnicking. lots of space on the grassy hillside.

name: big rig crossing
description: If your to big to cross the pontoon bridge on the E40 boarder road then head to here all bridges to here and back to Astrakhan are at least 30t limits.

name: Friendly Garage
description: Only stopped for a puncture but left with chicken wings and tea. Very friendly general garage if you‚Äôre in need. Owner speaks a little English.

name: Friendly caf√©, where you can camp!
description: Asked in the caf√© if we can park infront of the building and sleep in the car. They were super friendly and told us it is no problem and for free! Caf√© is open 24/7 with a little shop included. Pit toilets are just next to the building.

name: Bayanday
description: May be it‚Äôs not exact GPS point but if you are stop by the police for any raison, to know never pay cash for a fine. You have to go to a bank and put money on their account. This is the official way to pay the right price. Otherwise it‚Äôs for them like corruption. For us it was because we didn‚Äôt put the proper light. So we paid 3000 R and a gars later told us it‚Äôs a lot ! We are actually talking with an officer in Irkourtk to tell them about this corruption

name: Pustosjka
description: Small cabin next tot the road with yellow signal INSURANCE and green signal with Green Card in Russian language. We paid 6000 RUB for 1 year.

name: place on a lakeside
description: nice place ,gravel ground.perfect for a night

name: Irkoutsk center
description: Very quiet place for a night. Small parking behind the train reserve and the river at the end of the road, on the island, close to the citie center. No noise and see nobody at night.

name: To—áka caf√© restaurant
description:
Very nice and good cafe and restaurant. Retro ambiance. Very nice decoration. Good service good food. The menu is in English also. In a street corner inside an old and traditional house. 
Good price.

name: Dagistan russia
description: Fresh free wather. By site the smal mosk

name: Behind Building
description:
Quiet place behind building, camera observed, safe, little noise from train station trans sib at bottom of hill, very close to center, some good local restaurants, avoid weekends, bit noisy, during night quiet, good view from hill.
Iveco 90-16

name: The Wolga Camp
description:
Two tracks from paved road toward Wolga app 300m, some places below trees, 4x4 helpful, fits also big rigs, wild camp, very quiet, some places off sight.
directly at river Wolga.
Iveco 90-16

name: Insurance for Russia (and Georgia)
description: Car insurance for Russia (and Georgia in the same building). For Russian Car Insurance we payed R3200 for 30 days normal car (R2600 if it‚Äôs a company‚Äôs car). We got an official looking document, an accident document in case of accident and list of phone numbers to call. When continuing the main road we passed several other insurance offices advertising R1500 (don‚Äôt know for how long). Looking less official, but they might also do the work I guess..

name: Traktir
description:
A nice authentic coffee restaurant with a real cuisine, simple but very tasty. Fish, meat etc. Locals are coming to this place. Today they were organised a wedding. 
The owner is very helpful. Terrace in the summer. Good prices

name: Wild camping in the fields
description: Quiet and peaceful place amongst flowers and birds. I stayed there 2 nights and very few cars passed on the dirt road. Cattle is free so you won't be bothered by any shepherd dog. No shade.

name: Volga River Bank
description: Quiet site straight on riverbank. Near monastery. Very bad road to get to the river, about 1.5 km. Not recommended for normal camper vans.

name: Little beach with gazebo‚Äôs
description: Beautiful place at a lake. We arrived at dusk on a Sunday in May. No one there. Silent. No road-noise. Just Frogs and Cuckoos. We drove there by the dirt road between the trees and the fields. At the end you can park at an open space with grass, out of sight from the road. There‚Äôs a fence that was open, so we could park even closer to the water.

name: Camping / Bivak
description:
This very basic camping lies at walkable distance (+-1 km) of the center of Terskol and at 2 km of Azau and the Elbrus ski lifts. Facilities are rudimentary and toilets are only a hole in the ground. But it‚Äôs cheap and a safe place to camp. We stayed here for acclimatization hikes to observation point and started walking from here to the lifts up towards Mount Elbrus. 

*For 1 night: 100R per car + 100R per person. 
*100R per person for a hot shower. 
*300R per washing machine for clothes. 
*100R per day for leaving your car on the camping.

Beware, the administrator lady is mostly absent and hard to find. You can call her, but she speaks no English.

name: Forest camp close to border
description: Only half an hour from the border crossing, and hidden in the forest. We left the main road at 51.853289, 34.647233 and drove along the farm track. We turned into the first opening in the forest at right angles to where the grid reference is. There was a small clearing in the trees that had been used for logging. We initially drove further down the track where it became a hill. Even though it wasn‚Äôt very muddy (and we have 4WD) we got stuck coming back and had to winch ourselves up after not finding anywhere better to camp. Great protection by the trees from the wind and the rain. Very quiet. Lots of mosquitoes. Good for an overnight stop. Farmer in the field with his tractor as we drove out - he saw us but he didn‚Äôt pay any attention to us.

name: Car insurance for Russia
description: Hut on the right as you come through the border. We tried a couple of different places but they were all taking the price from the same sheet. One tried to charge us a different price from a different box on the sheet. No idea what each box was. We went with this person who pointed to a cheaper box! Cash only. No ATMs at the border. Another car insurance hut changed UAH to RUB. We had to drive to an ATM, found one at coordinates: 51.897917, 34.508372 less than 15 minute drive away. Minimum duration of cover was for 15 days, they said the insurance covers anyone to drive. We paid 2777 RUB for Land Rover Discovery 2.5 Diesel 2002.

name: The Wolga Riverside Camp
description:
Beautiful place + great scenery on rough track beside river, high clearance and 4x4 needed, avoid when heavy wet. some wet passages could be a real problem.
Iveco 90-16

name: Top of hill - Lake side
description:
4x4 and high clearance helpful, great view over lake; from west: app 100m up hill on gravel, turn right on track app 300m.
Iveco 90-16

name: Plateau beside Quarry
description:
Beside road (uphill driving) on right side large flat place with 2 entries, follow right track further uphill app.500 m to very flat area - large plateau, at the end of track (+100m) on rhs the quarry. Quiet and great view. 1 moose, no moskitos, good fierplace
4x4 and high clearance very helpful, not ok when very wet, could be dangerous downhill back. 
Iveco 90-16

name: The Skyjumpers Camp
description: Very friendly staff, pilots and jump instructors, quiet place at night, free, simple facilities, safe, get a tandem jump if you want, if you are lucky you can join a Russian BBQ

name: The Large Cave Parking
description: Between hotel and cave area: large flat parking site, free, locked during night (if locked at arrival: ask at reception! very friedly, little Englisch), very quiet, facilities in hotel. no 4x4 needed, fits all size of vehicles. Close to hotel: free and fast wifi.

name: In the Forest
description: Access on direct way from main road - impassable when we with heavy mud, 4x4 does not help  !! other access app. 3 km from East on paved road 200m, turn right on forest access road with concret pieces to junction and large logging place. Quiet and safe, just in the forest. If you are lucky - see a moose. Fits all sice of rigs; for tents - soso

name: next to lake 150m
description: very large area, fits all vehicles / rigs.some pit toilets. easy to swim

name: The Bushcamp road - railway
description: turn south from main road, after 200m on gravel road turn right, app 400m on rough gravel track large place. some trains during night, quiet. fit all rigs.

name: In the bush
description: Leave mainroad to the North, follow gravel track app 500m, turn left to forest track to fields app 70m, stay at side of forest beside fields, very quiet, 4x4 and high clearance helpful, for very big rigs could be to small.

name: Grassy spot with a view
description: Drive up a dirt road from the village. After some turns you will find a nice flat grassy spot. Near little stream. Very quiet. Only some cows with shepherd passed by, but it was no problem. Wonderful view

name: Propane gas station
description:
Friendly man was able to fill our propane bottle. He has some adaptors. 23 R per litre. 

We wanted to fill our bottle in Nalchik, but it appears the gouvernement does not allow it in or near a city. A super basic gas station in the backcountry is the way to go :)

name: Border control Russia
description: We were stopped and were not able to drive until the end of the valley. The border police checked our passports and asked a lot of questions. We wanted to go hiking for a day but we‚Äôre not allowed. They say you could only pass by with a valid permit.

name: Hotel –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è
description:
Nice and clean hotel in the center of Nalchik. The reception lady speaks a little English and you can ask for Visum registration (including in your stay).

*Double room: 3200R 
*Economy double room: 1400R (shared bathroom; excl. breakfast)
*Breakfast: 250R per person
*Guarded parking at the back of the hotel: 100R per day.

name: Water Tap
description: There is a blue street tap of drinkable water. The people around use it for domestic use, you can take as much you want, and it's free.

name: Parkinglot near Novosibirsk
description: small parkinglot next to a pond. Near M53.

name: Fieldroad
description: Easy to reach from motorway p 255, paved road

name: Geek Hostel
description: Small hostel with several rooms. Staff were friendly - didn‚Äôt speak very much English. We saw two of the rooms: one with a double and a single bed, no bathroom (use of the shared bathroom) for 1490RUB and one with double bed and en-suite for 1690RUB. After we looked around she said ‚Äúsale‚Äù and we ended up paying 1490 for the en-suite room. Small kitchen available to use - one burner on a small electric stove, microwave, fridge. WiFi average to slow speed, dipped in and out. Hot showers. Clean facilities. The beds in the bedrooms were up a ladder on a mezzanine so just like sleeping in our roof tent!! Free parking on site but it is not a secure car park. We had no issues though. Pretty good reviews on booking.com. Fun ‚Äògeek‚Äô theme running throughout with Marvel/Harry Potter/Doctor Who/Star Wars etc decorations.

name: Near M7
description: Gold place for to stay over night. mit visible Fromm street, not top noisy

name: Bozhonka
description: Place under trees at the outskirts of Bozhonka at the Riverside of River Msta.

name: The old farm
description: Hidden space to camp near to some old, crumbling farm buildings. Nothing special but it is not too far from the Kazakhstan border (took us about 1.5 hours to get to the border - we drove quite slowly). Could probably find a really good camping spot here but we didn‚Äôt spend too long looking and parked up when we found a place with short enough grass. The road from here to the main road is in much better condition than the main road itself! There were some temporary farm workers buildings by the road but they didn‚Äôt seem to mind us.

name: Sistunova Camping
description: not sure if really planned for camper vans. it has huts to rent and has a space for tents. however when we arrived nobody was there but it look new and clean but with no space for our bus so we drove the narrow forest track a bit further to the river bank where we found pit toilets and a beautiful spot with a perfect view. this spot was part of the campsite. the friendly owner arrived a few minutes later an unlocked the toilets for us. we have a VW LT, we are not sure if much bigger vehicles can drive to the river! showers and all are probably available at the main campsite. you pass by when arriving through the small village  Sistunova. We paid 1000 Rubel, maybe not that cheap for just a clean toilet and a lovely view, but ok!

name: At the lake
description:
Nice spot to camp directly at the shore. Nearly not visible from the road. Megafon LTE reception.
Some rubbish around.

name: Next to a graveyard
description: No mud, nice view, near m53, good gravelroad,

name: Near Mariinsk
description: Nice place next to a small creek, only in dry whether, only with 4x4,

name: "Berezovka" Hot Spring
description:
Basic Camping Site at the River Tobol with hot spring. At the moment no sanitary installation, just outhouse toilets. Large space on the grass for putting tents or cars, wooden houses for rent, parts of the area unser construction. Animal farm with birds, camels etc. Locals coming to take a bath at the hot spring.
We paid 200 rubels for 24 hours, 2 persons, campingcar and bath in the hot spring.

name: CTO Mechanic
description:
Great guys! They knew what to do, bought the parts and worked on it into the night. Super trustworthy! 
Maybe to small for big vehicles. For the hours they put into it really good price.

name: Alt Avto MAN
description:
Great truck workshop, real big with excellent equipment. Primary for MAN but can do all other trucks as well. 
They repaired our wheel bearing on an IVECO.
When it takes longer you can park and sleep on the huge premises they have.

name: Parking at Park
description:
Nice flat parking lot for all kind of vehicles.
Close to the park.

name: Small and Cozy Campspot beside a little lake
description: follow a small road for about 400m and than you will ending up on a small camping spot by a little lake and a fire place. close to the highway but no noise.

name: Ural Riverside
description: Nice campground next to the Ural river. plan and grassy spot after 5 km on a quite good track !

name: Angara River
description:
Picnic Area with tables and pit toilets (emergency only). 
Beautiful spot next to the river. Lot of firewood. Flies/moscitos depending of the season.

name: Lake shore 2
description: Follow dirt track to the right app 700 m, paass some fishermen huts to reach good flat area at lake and close to little river, fits all rigs. water: lake or river. some fireplaces.

name: The Beach
description: Behind monastry on beach track, several places, quiet, on track: no 4x4 needed; on beach: 4x4 helpful.

name: The Dunes and Beach
description: Take main sandy road to end or one of several tracks to the right. Tracks in the begin lead across dune area to beach, others close to the end are leading along beach. take your choice. Lots of places, some close to pine trees. On beach or dunes 4x4 very helpful. Fits all size of rigs.

name: Lakeside 1
description: Between road and lake Baikal; follow track to lake crossing inspecition track further down, if wet 4x4 and high clearance helpful; good coverage by trees..., quiet at night, direct access to lake 5m.

name: Best camp spot by the lake of baikal
description:
Follow the small road for about 3km, 4wd recommend because of a small water crossing, which depends to the weather conditions. Max. height: 3.50m.
the place is just next to the lake and it's one of the best spots, we ever had.
please take your rubbish with you!!

name: Irtysch Riverside
description: Wild place in the meadows of the River Irtysch. It might be a problem getting here by rain. Only creatures we met here where some sheeps, birds and insects, many moskitos. Road between Tobolsk and Ust Ichim is a dirt lane but leads through a lovely landscape. Impossible to continue this mud road by rain!

name: Beach Parking under Trees
description:
Very nice spot on the city beach for all kind of vehicles. No infrastructure, but I good for swimming!
Crowded during daytime, but quiet later during night.

name: Basa Odycha U Ozero (Kumysnyy)
description: Recreation Area at a lake, not far from the Highway. We stayed the night at their parking and payed 200 rubles for 1 Camper & 2 persons. Shower costs 100 rubles (but didn't work perfectly). They also rent rooms and there is a restaurant. Slow Internet with MTS cellphone. Moskitos as usual :)

name: Ob Embankment
description: Place on the gras on the dam of the Ob embankment lake. Many locals during the day, quiet at night. Less moskitos than usual. 4G Internet with MTS cellphone.

name: Wild Camp near a River
description: Wild Camp Spot near a river, lots of fireplaces, swimming option and beautiful nature. Fishing is possible.

name: Dirt road - spot for one night
description: Nothing special, just a spot for a night. Should be no Problem for bigger rigs.

name: Place for one night or so
description: Near a cemetery, but has a quiet side road and you can‚Äôt see the cemetery. Good for big rigs too, several spots if you follow the gravel road.

name: Wildcamping in the Woods
description: Wildcamping spot in the Woods. Bigger Rigs might fit depending on how confident you are off-road. We parked our landcruiser including our camper trailer at a nice spot.

name: Huge space in the woods
description:
Wild camp spot in the woods. Huge open space and multiple sites. Will fit several big rigs including trailers (if you can go a little bit off-road.)

Fire should be possible, no water I think.

name: Place near River just off the road
description: A nice place near the river, it seems that locals come here a lot for fishing and getting their boats to the water. Some fireplaces there. Big Rigs should fit as I fit with our landcruiser and conqueror trailer.

name: Russian and Kazakhstan insurance + SIM card
description: On the road from leaving the border the first cafe we saw, fed us, sold car insurance for both Russia and Kazakhstan and we were also able to buy a  SIM card. Sorted.

name: At a little Lake
description: Not far from street, but really quiet. some local‚Äòs around. One of them told us sleeping here is no problem, it‚Äòs normal. We spent one night here.

name: Tiny path hidden from main road
description: Quiet place behind birch trees 1km from main road. Good for all vehicles but no infrastructure. Flat gravel ground.

name: Nice Overnight Stay
description: Small place for one rig 300 m away from main road. Very quit. Nice view with little lake in front.

name: VSK Insurance / BCK Insurance
description: Insurance agency where you get your car insured after entering in Russia.

name: The Excavator Lake
description: Much space at a build lake. Very nice spot. Place for about 5 rigs.

name: Lakeside
description:
Nice spot with lots of space for all kinds of rigs! Can get ‚Äûcrowdy‚Äú during sunny days cause many locals come here.

Easy to maneuver with big rigs or trailers. 4x4 helps but it worked for our cruiser and trailer in 4x2.

name: Border Petukhovo
description: RUS‚Äî>KAZ, block dispatch for large vehicles, not very busy, yet slow. In total it took us less than 2 hours. Money exchange and insurance (if needed) directly behind the border.

name: Guesthouse
description: Good guesthouse in quiet area. 1000 Ruble per night per 2 people.

name: Hidden wild spot with great view
description: Totally into the wild spot above Chibit village with stunning view on the valley. Cross the village towards south and take a track which leads up on the mountain. It is quite steep but I think drivable with a 2wd, if dry though. Then you will have to turn right in a meadow to get there. Good trails for hiking or mountain biking around. For once there is no trash, so please leave no trace!

name: Cross Motel
description:
Good overnight stop while driving towards Moscow. 

A motel with clean and good facilities. You can tell they are used to foreign guests.

2000RUB for a double room, 150 for breakfast. 

We pay 150RUB for secured parking and stay in our small van for the night.

name: RUS - LV border
description:
NOT SO EASY in july 2023...


We arrived at 15:30 on a friday, two people with a GB car leaving Russia to Latvia. Be prepared to wait and people will cut lines if you are not paying attention..

Russian side took 1.5 hours (if you entered Russia from Kazakhstan, it will be important to have your kazakh vehicle declaration form).

30 min wait in no man's land

Latvia side took 1 hours 45 mins.

name: Place at river Voronezh - beside waste water treatment plant !!
description:
Place at river Voronezh where locals come to fish, we arrived at 16:00 with no one there... maybe because the algae bloom so swimming would be ugly lol

Place should fit big rigs no problem if you don‚Äôt mind some branch scratching on the way.

name: Izmailovo & antique market
description:
this is a big tourist place. It has the museum of vodka, museum of bread, a Kremlin art gallery, museum of toys, history of plastic, museum of navy, museum of vintage interior & more. For our liking a bit too many tourists though. Can feel like an amusement park.

on Saturday they hold a really amazing antique market. Very very big with all things Soviet. You cannot imagine it or it will be somewhere. Soviet school books, pins, posters, cameras, toys, jewelry, vinyl records... It's awesome, especially if you are good with haggling the price down. ;)

name: Alexeyevskoye
description:
Public parking just in front of the Volga river flowing 50 meters further along a nice sandy beach.
Lot of places to stay. Houses on the other side of the road behind a range of trees. Very calm.

name: Russian bordercrossing
description:
Not so busy crossing. 
Nice and friendly

name: Lake pepsie
description: At a private property with very friendly people. Just on a beach. Very quiet. Give him a few dollars and you never seen a happier russian before.

name: Mongol consulate
description:
Here you can apply for your mongol visa. Open monday to friday. On the morning for the request (from 9 to 12) and on the afternoon the day after for the recovery.
If you are going to Mongolia with your car you need : car registration (original and copy) / driver licence (original and copy) / one id photo / copy passport (and original) 70 $ in cash/person.

name: By the lake
description: Lakeside grassy with cabins as an option. Kronshtadskoye Vodokhranilishche –ö—Ä–æ–Ω—à—Ç–∞–¥—Å–∫–æ–µ –≤–æ–¥–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏–ª–∏—â–µ.

name: Campsite near a lake
description:
Nice grassy spot alongside a lake. Some fisherman on the lake with boats and only 1 car passed by early morning. We had no mosquitoes during the day but some from 8pm as almost everywhere in the region. There is a small shop in the village near the lake 2-3km further on the road from the spot.
8km of good diet track to reach the spot from the main road
Edge internet only

name: Decent spot by small lake
description:
Out of sight somewhat flat space for wild camping by a lake. You can still hear the road a little but not too bad. Intermittent 4G on mts. 

Coordinates are for m the place are at the lake itself. Turning point off the road coordinates are: N51.999111 E44.474122

Turn off asphalt onto dirt road. After 70meters aprx take slightly less driven dirt road on the left (just at corner) then 30 meters ahead you will be able to see lake.

2wd should be ok. 

Lake not really for swimming...

Not suitable during rainy / wet times, lots of mud.

name: Campingpark Sova
description: Very nice campground directly on a fantastic clean lake. There is possibility to park between the trees in the shade, or directly at the lake. Electricity, water and waste dump is provided, as well one shower and toilet. No gray water disposal. The owner is a very friendly guy and speaks good english.

name: Laundry Ital clean
description: This is a low price laundry, with good results. No self service.

name: Tiger Hostel
description:
Excellent location just 330m from main transport hub. Walking distance to pedestrian walking street. Spotlessly clean. Well-designed and managed. Excellent staff--Kate helped me translate a technical Russian form for 3 hrs! Roman was very helpful in so many ways. Big, fluffy, friendly dog. One of the best.

Free laundry. Free filtered water.

Free parking for up to 12 motorcycles or 3 small cars/trucks. Neither fenced in nor guarded, but VERY out-of-the way and safe under CCTV.

Entrance is up the old stairs across the street from Hotel Moryak on Pos'yetskaya St.

name: City (sushi) cafe bar
description:
Very good restaurant with delicious sushis, our firsts since Europe and there were amazing!
The menu has other types of food such as soups, salads, noodle wok (veg possible), sweet and sour pork. The other dishes we took that were not sushi were very good as well. 

Very good address, no English spoken but service very professional and smiling. Outside terrasse on a big road 

Tr√®s bon restaurant qui propose de d√©licieux sushis, nos premiers depuis l‚ÄôEurope et on a √©t√© impressionn√©s !
La carte (avec photos) propose d‚Äôautres plats type soupes, salades, wok de nouilles (v√©g√©tarien propos√©), porc sauce aigre douce... les plats autres que sushis que l‚Äôon a pris √©taient tr√®s bons aussi. 

Tr√®s bonne adresse, anglais non parl√© mais service tr√®s pro et souriant. Terrasse sur rue.

name: Up the hill above Gorno Altaiysk
description:
Nice area at the top of a pass between 2 hills (flat spot quite narrow). Steep dirt track to get there, could be difficult to access if muddy (we had 4x4 low gear to go up). Access to dirt track on this point 51.976471, 85.941843

Quiet, nice views on the green valleys. There is an electrical line but you forget about it very quickly. 
2 russian people came up the hill, very friendly, did not stay long. 

Careful some mosquitoes (as soon as the wind is down) and ticks, and some strong winds if stormy. So watch out for weather conditions before going up. 

After all we had a great time there, good place for people who want to be in the nature at night while enjoying the city in the day

name: Nice views over river (no big rigs)
description:
Just after the bridge on the left (if heading direction Moscow) there is a small mud path that bends around and up, follow that path for a few hundred meters and you can camp with nice view overlooking the river. 

Cars can be heard but isn‚Äôt too bad. 

2G on mts

If you can make it up the first 10meters, the rest is pretty easy path through the field. 

Only saw a fisherman otherwise no people but it‚Äôs close to a small village.

name: Lakeside Torbeyevskoye Ozero
description:
Nice sand beach spot directly on the lake.
Clear water for a swim. Dirtroad that leads to the spot is quite bad. Very quiet at night.

name: Reaktor24
description: Huge 24/7 Autorepair and Spares Shop in Omsk! They are very friendly and can do every diagnostic and repair. They took our car alongside the regular (full) program and found the fault (broken air intake hose) and repaired the same day! For Almost 5 hours of labor and parts they only charged 50$. Highly recommended! Car was a Landrover Defender 110 from 2013. They even have a restaurant and a waiting room with TV.

name: Lakeside
description: A wild camp on a side of a tiny body of water. 300m from the main road but sheltered.

name: Kafe Transit
description: Restaurant with very nice food. Lot of choices. Point and shout ordering so no English required. Clean toilets.

name: Night Flight Hotel
description:
It is a place for fishing holidays with hotel infrastructure. The people are very friendly. The kitchen woman speaks English.
We took a shower in one of the hotel apartments and ate something for dinner. It‚Äôs no problem to camp in the park of the hotel.

name: By the River
description:
Nice place! Even saw two elks in the evening.
Track is very muddy, because it was raining the day before.

name: Beeline - SIM card
description:
Beeline shop at entrance of supermarket. All offers include unlimited internet. We were told we can only get Beeline as foreigners.

Friendly staff, no English. Can pay by Visa/MasterCard (also ATMs next door).

name: Centeral Hostel (and Hotel)
description:
Hostel (and Hotel) incredibly located in the heart of Moscow (300 meters far from Bolsho√Ø Theater and 10 minutes walking from Kremlin)
Just 700 roubles per night in dorm of 6. All the comfort needed. Fantastic staff! They arranged parking for our Toyota, in a public place, at just 50 meters far from the hostel and for only 500 roubles per day! Not for big rigs as you have to park in a regular place. And they don‚Äôt require the visa registration card !!! We stayed 3 incredible days!

name: Waterpump
description: Waterpump next to street. Drinking water.

name: Birch grove
description: Lovely wild camp on a bank of a lake. It‚Äôs next to a picturesque village and a busy train line but that soon fades into the background. The locals use this lake for swimming and fishing.

name: Next to Chasovnya Nikolaya Chudotvorstva
description: A medium size car park just above the highway with a small camp spot off to the side. Right next to a ‚Äúplace of worship‚Äù.

name: River camping
description: Nice overnight spot at the river, quiet, but still only some minutes away from the road. We enjoyed the sunset after a late border crossing.

name: River island camp
description:
Beautiful spot with sandy beach on an island in the river. Totally quiet and surrounded by great, rocky scenery. Lots of firewood and butterflies. 
Of course you have to watch the river level. 
4WD necessary to get over the river during this time of the year.

name: Tarumovka
description: On the village, far of main road, near a very small pond . People around friendly.

name: Beautiful place near the beach of Caspian Sea
description:
Really nice place for some camping. A little bit windy due to the Caspian Sea nearby but it helps with the temperatures in summer ;)

Depending on where you camp the Caspian Sea is 50-100m away, lots of sand dunes and bushes. Very little trash compared to other popular spots. Locals come by from time to time but are very friendly and some shared there mulberries and cherries with us!

Be prepared for some cows that might pass by ;)

Super place if you travel with a dog or a trailer. If you like to stay a view days you should have some supplies since there is no shopping nearby. Big rigs fit easy, but there are two bridges which I don‚Äôt know how much weight they support... we passed with the trailer and are at 4,5 tons.

name: Before border Kaz a. Rus
description:
good place, friendly and helful for Rus and Kaz insurance
Iveco 90-16

name: Muddy feet
description: Pleasant camp spot on the bank of a river. Grass/sand base. Visible from the highway.

name: Cezve Coffee - Moscow
description: Nice (Turkish) relaxed cafe with a tasty, simple menu and friendly staff that speak English. Cezve Cafe on Yandex. There is normal city parking on the street that the cafe is on.

name: K–∞—Ç—é—à–∞ hotel restaurant
description: We just took a lunch here, very good and cheap, but it is also a hotel with cabins. They were super friendly and helped us with a bit of mechanics on the motorcycle. Speaks a bit of English, and good working wifi.

name: River and beach camp
description: Nice spot right at the river with a sandy beach under trees. Plenty of firewood, great scenery. You can hear the road, but there are not many cars. No 4WD needed.

name: Car Insurance
description: You can get car insurance for Russia and Kazakhstan here. We paid 1200 rubel for a Pickup for 15 days (for Russia).

name: Sim Card
description: You can get sim cards (Beeline or Megaphone) at the same place where you can get the car insurance, very handy.

name: New Prussia Camp
description: Simple camp, no facilities, no English, lots of mosquitoes.

name: Lions head
description: Several options for camp spots along the river or higher up with great views.

name: Memorial Voinam-Omicham
description:
Small and quiet place for parking near the City. I sleep 2 night here. No Services 
In the near is a Park and over the Bridge is the City.

name: Free town water supply
description: Town drinking water supply. Free and 24/7.

name: Novoselenginsk, Decembrist museum
description: This nice museum tells the story of noble exiles who ended up here after the coup in 1825. Entry fee 100 rubel. The museum is housed in a pink salmon building just 100 meters from the parking spot.

name: Overlooking the Dubovskiy and Volga rivers
description: Follow the partly paved road, turn left at the crossing of a dirt road to a relatively flat and open area overlooking the rivers. Good for all types of vehicules. Seems to be a recreational area for locals. No services but clean. Quiet and lovely view.

name: Parking next to a Lake
description: Parking next  to a Lake.  Ideal for a stopover when traveling to jekaterinburg. Small bar available and official swimming area where locals stay.

name: Erholungspark am Fluss
description:
Very nice place near the river. Direct in the park of Stolby. At Night very quiet.
I pay 500 Rubel for a Night.

name: Mercedes Orlovka
description: Good adress if you need help with your truck, like MB, Kamaz or Bosch service.

name: Votkinsk lake
description: Lot of space here, between the lake and the forest. Not very flat. People come by in the evening but very quiet at night.

name: Berries' paradise
description:
Paradise tall forest just next to the highway. Plenty of spots, shade everywhere and even picnic tables if needed. Just turn off the highway at the paved road, take the right turn passing in front of the picnic tables and find your spot!

No 4x4 needed, noise from highway depending where you stop.

Bonus: lots of wild berries and cherry trees!

name: Riverside camping
description: A nice place, just 2 km from the M5. Next to a river, so lots of mosquitos, but it still made a good overnight stay. There are many places you can park your car/camper. Just drive a bit further down the road to find other spots.

name: At the River Birjussa
description: It is a wild Camping at the river. In Maps.me it is a campsite. Many locals here for fishing or Barbecue but quiet. You hear only the street.

name: Sandy Beach @ Wolga
description: nice beach, locals camp here as well, even with motorhomes, tree for shade, nice for swimming, might be busy, we did not camp here

name: Nice and quite place for camping
description: Very nice greeny place for wild camping near small river.

name: Wild camping spot at river Tschussowaja
description: Nice place directly next to the street that passes and above the river. Very quiet and a nice view. the only thing there were a lot of mosquitos when we have been there. Perfect stop when you are visiting Perm 36 and don't want to go further...

name: Field Camp - Riverside
description: Nice campsite on a grass field next to a river. Quiet place. Locals come here to fish and camp. Multiple places in the field. No facilities

name: Katun River
description: Small plateau with beautiful view. Below is the Katun River, up are the mountains. Lovely Altai Mountains! No MTS or Beeline Signal.

name: St. Ar Hotel
description:
Great little hotel on the corner of a houseblock. Well appointed rooms, WiFi , free visa registration. The lady swiftly uses Google translate to answer all your questions. Good cafe –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ  to have homecooked food nearby. We paid 2800 roebel on arrival. Only public parking.

http://www.booking.com/Share-dgHg5a

name: Camping spot Valday NP
description: A few beautiful spots next to the lake. The other spot is now behind a fence. Picknicktable, dry toilets, access to lake. Tick warning. Alternative picknickspots on the road to the monastery. Camping allowed.

name: Wolga riverside
description: Many places along the Wolga. Several people stayed there, but it was quiet at night. Ample space. Road is rough to get there, but Russians make it with their normal cars. Beautiful view.

name: Shower & toilet stop
description: Execellent. 10 roebel to use bathroom (huge toilet), 130 shower (real bathroom with haidryer). Very kind lady.

name: Camp with a view
description: Gorgious spot under big trees overlooking fields. Asked local if we could sleep here, answer: why not! No garbage around, no amenities. Quiet.

name: Water at Pavillon
description: There is a water source at the back of the "pavillon" (look for a bench under roof). When you are at the parking area, you will see the source in the direction of the wood. High pressure.

name: Parking Lot-Art Penza hotel
description: The parking lot is next to the Art Penza Hotel near the lake, where you can swim and use the beach for a small fee (200 rubel?), toilets near the beach, not sure if they are open all night.

name: Great river camp
description:
Most quiet and scenic spot that we saw in the whole area. Directly at the river, nice hiking possibilities, plenty of firewood, trees, no people. 
4WD helpful since you have to cross two river arms in this time of year.

name: It's a Spot
description: Not a great spot, but away from the main road and out of sight. Lots of mosquitoes, trash, and road noise. It's a spot, and the only spot I could find for miles.

name: Ostrog Bike Post, Chita
description:
Part of the "Bike Post" network of motorcycle clubhouses for long-distance motorcycle travelers. Big clubhouse with bunk bed dorm rooms and couches in the loft. Secure, gated motorcycle parking. Lots of tools if you need to work on the bike.

Electricity, kitchen, outdoor unheated shower, lots of grills, firepits, nearby river for swimming.

I arrived unannounced at 9:15pm to a hero's welcome and they cooked me dinner and drank me under the table. Then a rock band had a jam session in the bar for a couple hours.

Clubhouse is free but you should donate to the club. And make sure to sign the guestbook!

Contact Vairan (Vladimir) via Whatsapp +7 924 501-55-51

name: Opposit Bike Club
description: Part of the Bike Post system of safe overnight stops for long-distance motorcycle riders.

name: near a pond
description: next to a pond where locals swim, narrow and bumpy track with lot of low branches, however 3 meter hight is ok if you dont worry about paint. might be difficult when wet, then probably only with 4x4

name: Chibitka River
description: Place at the River/ Lake of Chibitka with very nice view to the glaciers.

name: Gazprom with fuel and water
description: water tap right on the corner of the station with a lot of pressure!

name: Motorcycle mechanic
description:
Mikhail is a very nice guy with very good motorcycle knowledge. He is a local karting champion and build his gokarts himself.
He was recommend by Vladimir at Alta√Ø Moto in Manzherok.
I had a leak in my water pump that he tried to fix it the best he could. It turns out that I really need to replace the pump but at least he tried.
He doesn't speak English but his son does.

name: Discovery Hotel
description: Hotel with discount for motorcycle travelers. Rooms very clean, 15 euro per room for 24hours...you come 8pm checkout 8pm next day. Sauna space with dunk pool and bbq garden. Restaurant in the basement with cheap good food. Very clean. Parking under camera surveillance in front of front door. Friendly staff, owner Michael (a local biker) speaks English and can be reached by staff on telephone.  Michael is a source to help Bikers in case of mechanical or other issues.

name: Banya Hotorok
description:
Russian traditional Sauna complete with toilets, shower, sauna, dunk pool, bbq space, sound system, tv, wifi, water fountain, kitchen space (sink, counter, fridge). From 1000 roubles per hour.

Owner Michael speaks English and can be reached by the friendly staff by phone if necessary. Michael is a friend of Motorcyclists (member of the GoldWing Club) and can help if necessary.

name: Rushotel Camping
description:
Rushotel offers the possibility to camp on a parking space, electricity and water is included, toilet in the hotel can be used. 
the price for our Pickup camper was 1500 rubels per day plus 500.- per day per person

since a hotel room is about the same price (at least over booking.com), we decided to take a room instead.

not a very good option for camping...even when staying in the car you might be better of with booking a room!

name: Memorial Tsar Nicolas II
description: Incredible and beautiful place to visit. Churches and museum in memory of the last Russian Czar and his family murdered by the bolchevick. You can stay at night on the big parking. In the forest, very quiet. Toilet. All it is free.

name: 24 hour cafe and  large parking area for lorries
description: Large parking area for trucks with a 24 hour cafe with a clean toilet. We ate in the cafe and parked behind it shielding is from some of the road noise although we didn‚Äôt find the road very busy. Opposite a petrol station.

name: Tirolja outdoor store
description: Great store for all kind of outdoor equipment, mostly high-quality brands: hiking shoes and equipment, rain/ winter jackets/ warm underwear (also for kids), tents, sleeping bags, gas stoves.

name: Motorcycle shop
description:
Big motorcycle shop with a very nice lady. 
The shop is 2nd floor, over a car tire shop.

name: Good motorcycle mechanic
description:
Max does some mechanic in his garage. He has been recommended to me by the Moto shop in Irkutsk. 
He is really friendly and speaks some English. He is really good at mechanic in general and even built custom vehicles (bikes and cars) for movies. 
He can help you with basic stuff (oil change, brake pads etc..) but you need to buy the spare parts first.
Also, you have to contact him on WhatsApp first, otherwise he may not be there.
His number : +7 964 278-31-66

name: Between the trees
description: Follow a track leading into the fields and you'll find several patches if trees.High grass makes a comfortable bed. Suitable for (motor) bikers. Not visible from the main road, no water.

name: Omsk
description: Parking near Park and memorial ww. Lot of people during the day but quiet at night. Mosquitos

name: Nazran
description: Parking next to a theater. Not the most romantic place but Ok for one night. Lots of space. Close to the main road but not so noisy at night. Coming from Georgia it took us 4 hours to cross the border and we were just looking for a place to sleep before hiting the road to Kazakhstan in the morning.

name: Fountain
description: Operate the handle to fill the bottles and jerrycan. Drinkable water.

name: Barabinsk
description: Small place in the city near a memorial. People during the day, but quiet at night.

name: In the woods next to Tura river
description: Nice place above Tura river. Drive till the village –°–∞–ª–∞–∏—Ä–∫–∞ and then follow the street next to the river. 4x4 required, at least when it's wet. Very quite.

name: Supermarket & ATM
description: Inside the yellow building you can find an ATM accepting VISA and a big supermarket with lots of (western) products.

name: Camping with view on the lake
description:
Very nice camping spot with a beautiful view on the lake.
You can choose to camp on a hill, or next to the water.
Motorcycle are now forbidden above this point but you are allowed to be here.
Beware of the sand on your way ;)

name: Beeline SimCard
description:
Beeline shop where you can buy a Russian SimCard. 200GB - 350 roubels. Valid for 2 weeks.
Bring your passport.
They don‚Äôt speak any English, but try to help you. (In the beeline store at Barnaul they denied to sell us a SimCard as foreigners.)

name: FunKey Hostel
description: Nice Hostel in the city centre of Novosibirsk. We asked if we can park the car in front of the hostel (no closed area, but a quiet side street). They said yes. For 250 roubles/person we were allowed to use the hot showers and toilets. Everything nice and clean. Friendly people working at the reception. The girl didn‚Äôt speak English, but used Google Translator. So everything was very easy.

name: Railway museum
description: Beautiful museum outside. 250roubles per person. Children pay too.

name: Water pump
description: Right next to the street is a pump where you can easily fill up your watertank. For free.

name: Behind a little hill
description: For (motor)bikers: heading here by the dirt road, you'll see a big tree on your left, about 80 mtrs into the field. There's a little hill with a nice flat inlet, covered all around. You won't be seen from the road or track - some noise from the main road, but bugs were very manageable when I was there (unlike many other places). Good for a quiet night!

name: Water pump
description: Along the road there is a water pump. Quick and easy fill up of your water tank. For free.

name: Beautiful spot at the lake
description: Flat spot with nice view at the lake, about 100km before the border.

name: Isuzu Iveco fuso repair
description:
Truck repair. We went there with our Mercedes Sprinter and the did a really good job. 
TheY fix a kabel at the fuel injector and made oil change with 12 Liter oil and it costs about 7000 Rubel.

name: Water Pump
description: Water pump next to the street. Very good water. Locals drink it.

name: Riverside Camping
description:
Very nice place where you can camp with your Camper Van or your tent. Table with a roof. Place for fire and barbecue place. 
Electricity provided. The people were very friendly and helpful. We went to the banja/sauna across the street and rented it for 2 hours private use.

name: Wood Dreams
description: Awesome hospitality. Great tips for sightseeing and trips. Most friendly and helpful people we met in Russia!

name: Near the Road to Ferry
description: Very nice and quiet place on Gras. Many small hills and little animals looks like Murmeltier. We stay here for a night.

name: Viktor Motorbike repair
description: Viktor is your man fixing your motorbike! Drive up the ramp in this location an turn left inside the building. At the end of the floor you will Viktor at the right hand side!

name: Gas station propane
description: Here you can find gas, European bottles ok.

name: Water source
description: Water tap next to the road. Good fresh water

name: Water pump
description: Public water pump. Quick and easy fill up for your water tank. For free.

name: The Tourist
description:
Guesthouse right at the lake with a big courtyard and a large common area.
For 500RUB (2 people) we were allowed to use the toilet and the huge common kitchen. Unfortunately they have no shower (just in combination with a room).
Secured parking behind the building.
Friendly, no English speaking staff.

name: River camp
description: Nice and quiet overnight spot directly at the river with fireplaces on grassy ground under pine trees.

name: Water pump
description: Water pump in a nice little village. Locals drink the water.

name: River camp
description:
Nice and very quiet spot at the river under birches with a fireplace on grassland. No internet.
4WD helpful especially in rainy weather on the muddy bumpy road with one steep part.

name: next to the lake
description: wild camping, very quiet. next to the lake.  wind on the day.

name: Car insurance booth
description: Coming from Nuijamaa direction St. Petersburg (23 km), on the premises of the first fuel station a small car insurance booth.

name: beach
description:
beach on the Volga River, with locals people, water is clean.
car park free. shop at 5min by walk...

name: Quiet place with nice view close to main Siberian road
description: Very beautiful and safe place for wild camping. We past the small village and on the top of mountain turn left. A lot of mascots.

name: Place for one night just near the m4 autobahn
description: Place for the night near the autobahn/highway m4, it‚Äôs on a dirtroad. Nothing special but good for one night!

name: Katun River Lookout
description:
Flat plateau overlooking the Katun River. No shade, more like sheep pasture. So quiet you can hear the river.

The maps are wrong, there is no longer the suspension bridge at Inya to access the R373. Follow the newly constructed bridges and road to Inegen, and backtrack. There are some narrow cliffside passages that would be limit for larger vehicles.

name: Chulyshman river
description: Stunning views. Camping spot with latrine and covered picnic hut with place for several tents. Beach access to a back eddy on the river out if the main current of the river. Swimming possible brrr. Fire pits. Right next to road, but little night traffic. Fishing possible.

name: Wild Camping next to the river Angara
description: Very nice and lovely place next to the river Angara. A lot of space on the bank, so you can choose where to stop. Local people around. Very quite at night and nearly no mosquitos!

name: STA Mechanic
description: We had to change our breakes. we had the parts with us. Somebody speaks a little bit English. It seams to be an official Mercedes mechanic. Very big. The garage is in the backyard. but you can see the sign STA from the street. Did a good job and very quick. Nice guys.

name: French Alliance
description: We were in this French Alliance, very friendly people, the can help you, they gave piece of advice. We met Russian young people and we went to walk in the city with them. Note that the alliance is intended for French speaking people.

name: By the canyon
description: Really nice place with an amazing panorama where you can watch the sunset. The spot is close to a small canyon with a river. The canyon seems to be a small natural phanonemen. Water looks very clean so you could even take a bath. There is some local tourists dropping by from time to time to take pictures. The time we stayed one evening (weekday) it was only 3 cars.

name: Internet Store
description: It's a small store opposite to a supermarket (it moved to the other side of the GPS coordinate) where you can buy sim cards from MTC, as well as mobil phones.

name: By River Oka
description:
This nice spot is easy to reach. It is at a side arm of the river Oka. It is close to a small street. There is a few more spots between the side arm and the actual river Oka. Locals go here too but it was absolutely quite when we stayed. Some cars on the street passing by though, but all in all it is a quite place. 

We have a Truck with good ground clearance and there is other places a little bit further south. These were accessible for us too but we have no 4x4 and it started to rain so we were a bit scared to get stuck. Just check for other spots around here on Google Earth.

name: Arshan Campsite
description: No apparent campgrounds in/near town. Was pointed to this spot by locals. Must cross easy, shallow creek. Start immediately south of west end of red foot bridge. Flat, dirt spot for tents with fire ring. Reasonably hidden but not 100% stealth. Safe town. Driveable path ends 50m before and is good for campers/vans. Motorcycles can make it all the way to campsite.

name: Zagza Hot Spring
description:
Indoor swimming pool filled with hot spring water. 250/adult, no time limit. Nicer, newer, cleaner, and hotter than Arshan hot spring and same price.

Located on the grounds of Zagza resort, with cabins, restaurant, picnic tables, benches, inflatable bounce house, and Baikal beach. Second-best outhouse toilet I've seen in Russia.

Road is pretty good first 55 km, then new and perfect final 20 km...whew! Guarded, gated parking is RUB50.

name: Arshan Hot Spring
description: Approximate location of Arshan Hot Spring. Must walk from the main road--park in guarded paid parking 300m west. 250/adult, 20 min limit. Indoor swimming pool with warm, cloudy water but hot water spurts from a pipe. Water is cloudy and heavy with minerals. Inflatable beach balls provided.

name: Baikal Campground
description: A few dozen campsites within trees along Lake Baikal. Each has a covered picnic table and its own outhouse. Looks pretty new and nice. More secure than wild beach camping.

name: Aqua-Life hotel
description: In backyard you can park your car/motorcycle. People cannot see from the street. Clean and helpful staff. 3500 rub/2 persons.

name: City Hotel
description: There is a small parking area for 2 motorcycles. Clean, quiet, with local breakfast and close to airport.

name: Baikal sunset beach
description: Continue a little further into the forest, past the more frequented spots along the road, and you'll get to another track leading to the pebble beach. Super nice, especially for (motor)bikes taking a little path into the green and you'll be completely seconded. Dramatic sunset! Refreshing morning bath. Mosquitoes bearable!

name: wild camp
description: quiet place in a little village. next to a small church. lots of birds!

name: Camping with view
description: Nice and very quiet overnight spot on a field with flowers, trees and a beautiful view. 4WD helpful for the short steep way up.

name: Hill camp for 4WD
description:
Overnight spot on a hill with nice view for off-roaders who do the track between Aisoro and Tolparovo (the last two pictures illustrate the path).
The track is 22 km long and intense - from here 5 km to Aisoro and 17 km to Tolparovo. 4WD is necessary; after rainy days (as in our case) you also need a winch. We had to get several trees out of the way, cross huge mud puddles, manage steep muddy parts and change/ inflate tires. In some parts, the trees are standing too narrow for big rigs.

name: public water tap
description:
public water tap on corner of street.
maybe drinking water, really clear and fresh tube connexion not possible...

name: Consulate Turkmenistan
description: Official opening hours are on M, T, T and F 9am-1pm. Visa process quite fast and straightforward.

name: Baikal Museum
description: A very interesting museum about the Baikal, the landscape, the nature and the wildlife.

name: Lake camp
description:
Great overnight spot at a lake with a sand beach, grassy field and trees. Sunset, firewood and a nice swim included.
You can hear the road and the train, but you see only lake and trees.

name: Wild camp in the woods along a river
description: On our way to the nearby ‚Äúriver camp‚Äù we found this place in the woods and with river view. 1 km after leaving the Baikal highway there‚Äôs the opportunity to turn left into a gravel road. At the end of this gravel road choose the middle lane and you‚Äôll find the spot a bit further on the right. Alternatively, you can drive further and go to the other wild camp spot. The gravel road is a bit narrow, potentially a big camper will be able to get here.

name: ERGO
description: just outside of the border, at first gas station. Around 10 euros per month for motorbike insurance. Folks are really nice.

name: Iveco Ufa
description:
Professional car service.
I entered the service with many damages on my Iveco Daily 4x4 55S18 and they solved many of them within hours, i.e. changed my radiator and fan, renewed my coupling, etc.
They have lot‚Äòs of Iveco spare parts.
They only speak russian, but i think i was the first tourist there. Communication with translation was no problem, because they‚Äòre really friendly and professional.

name: View Point Camping
description: In the meadow (solid), on top of a hill, with a wide view over a deep valley on the one hand and some snow covered peaks (4000+) on the other hand. Very quiet at night despite adjacent to the (unpaved) road to the necropolis Dargaws.

name: Remains of an Abandoned Ancient Village
description: Meadow in the middle of the ruins of an ancient settlement with typical caucasian defence towers (accessible over a bumpy dirt road).  Very quiet, no poeple around. Great view on the nearest snow covered peaks. Water source on the roadside ca. 3,5 km westwards.

name: Lonesome Lake
description: Small plane parking area on the lakefront surrounded by a forrest. Adjacent to a road with nearly no traffic. Very quiet at night apart from a million of croaking frogs ;o)

name: Quiet bushcamp
description:
Camp spot between trees in the shade in farmland. Completely invisible from all sides so you get privacy! Very quiet, didnt see anybody, however since there is farmland around I can imagine some farmers can come by.

Note: the actual location of this spot is a little further than the coordinates. From the main road follow the gravel road until you reach a small intersection. Go straight and all the way to the end in the corner you go to the right through a small ditch to reach the camp place.

Some ground clearance is recommended for going through this ditch. All 4x4s should be fine. Not suitable for big rigs.

name: 4x4 TravelClub
description: Very professional mechanics, they do over landing and off road them selves. There is a bathroom and running water. All needed information you can get from them.

name: Parking near gas station, cafe
description: A big parking space with a nice view, 24/7 gas station. Shower, bathroom and laundry for 150rub each. Cafe kitchen lets you recharge water for free. Megafon 3G works!

name: Vast green fields
description: Around 700 m west from the gas station (cheapest diesel we‚Äôve seen in the area) there is a road that disappears into vast fields. 4x4 probably required, if you want to go far. But a nice place to pitch a tent or stay in a camper van, no people. We went up a small hill there, great view. Megafon 3G works great.

name: Small village shop
description: There is a small village shop in case your need some food or supplies, very cheap.

name: Truckstop Ufa
description: Yes, it is a Truckstop. Not more, not less. Good for a night. It's quite new though. 150 Rub per car. Showers are very nice and clean, 100 Rub.

name: Field behind cafe
description: There is a cafe, place is popular among truck drivers. If you follow the dirt road to the right,  you can spend the night in the field, away from lights and trucks. Being a couple, take into consideration that there is a dazan nearby, like a local temple. We arrived at night and had no idea, such a shameful morning :) good Megafon 3G reception. Clouds of mosquitos at times, then they mysteriously disappear.

name: Quiet camp between bushes
description:
A quiet grassy place between bushes and trees. Also a river near this place. Not like the steppe. It is 300 meter outside of the village of Promyslovka, you can‚Äôt be seen because of the vegetation. Only a farmer came by. We had a good night of sleep.

4x4 and a little bit of ground clearance would be recommended for the last part of the dirt track.

Directions: when you face the local mini market (produkti) you turn left and around 50m just after the last house house on your left you turn left and take the dirttrack.

name: Next to a sunflower field
description: This time of the year not too easy to find a spot, fields and grass still very high. Follow track from the main road, narrow/cut grass on the left, shade from trees.

name: Enesej Hostel
description: Clean hostel, fair price, 550 Rubel per person. Kitchen and big parking space. Entrance narrow for big rigs, but you can park in front in the street. They do registration.

name: Tyumen
description: Small hostel with comfortable beds. Clean, although bathroom is a bit tiny. Hostel lenin, it‚Äôs a small building on a inner courtyard.

name: Links, Avtoservis Shinomontazh
description: Came in with an leaking axle seal fixed it that morning. Staff was knowledgeable but didn‚Äôt speak English. Had to use a translator app.

name: Camp in a big field
description: I just drove off the main highway. Drove past the cemetery. Took the track on the right and found a nice place about 1,5 km from the road. Behind some trees. Quite and rubbish free. Might need 4x4 wan it rains.

name: Camp near mars2
description: We asked the people of the mars site if we could camp. They pointed out a spot 100 beyond the entrance. More people camp here. Wind goes down after sunset. And camping is included in the 50r fee.

name: River camp
description:
Great overnight spot right at the river with sand beach, small trees and a beautiful sunset. There were no other campers here on a weekend in high season, only many big and small boats on the river.
4WD helpful to get over the little creek right before you reach the spot.
There are nice spots also before the creek, but they were quite busy.

name: Water Tap
description: Good fresh water for free. Locals use it to drink.

name: Europe / Asia Marker
description: Large monument marking the border of Europe and Asia.

name: Nautilus Hotel
description: Double room with private bathroom and a/c for 1000 rubles a night; private parking out the back.

name: John Gregor Old Pub
description: Pub with good selection of (Belgian) beers!

name: Flat camping spots by the river
description: Take a dirt road to the left before the bridge, drive towards the river. There are many camping spots, both open and bushy, along the river to the right. Great Megafon 3G reception. No 4x4 required. Easy access to water, no beach though, but good enough to fish or refill water. Quiet at night, and surprisingly clean.

name: birch forest
description: good for an overnight Rest after a long day on the road. no 4x4 needed. turn off at the gas station and take the dirt road. all rigs  no Problem

name: 100 friends carbox
description:
very good and helpful people 
helped me a loz and went shopping the right oil for me. Very cheap price.
i strongly recommand.

name: Azimut Hotel
description:
Refurbished soviet era hotel.
Secure parking lot and central location. I used booking.com to get a good weekend deal: 1600 rb for a standard single room. Week days around 2000 rb. 

Nice Asian restaurant at the ground floor.

name: FBR bike parts
description:
Good selection of motorcycle gear and parts. The CEO Anton is a nice guy, very helpful and speaks English. 

Down the street (basically in the same building) there‚Äôs also a motorcycle workshop run by a mechanic named Vladimir. He can change tires. Not the most friendly or welcoming place though.

name: Water source with high outcome
description:
Water Source with very high pressure ‚Ä¶
A lot better than the one at the river. Fills 100l within a minute ;‚Äì)
A little hard to build adapters...

Admin note: Unknown if potable water.

name: Nika Moto - spare parts, tires, etc.
description:
Good selection of spare parts, clothing, helmets, and motorbike related material. I found a Shinko tire here, when the Heidenau I ordered from Moscow got lost in transportation. Arthur, the shop owner, doesn't speak too much English but it willing to communicate through Google Translate. Contact by Whatsapp: +7 892 432 39281 or +7 892 433 34855
https://nikamoto.ru/

name: Tire repair
description:
